lines.value: the most common organisms found are campylobacter an organism of animal origin salmonella also often of animal origin cryptosporidiosis animal origin giardia lamblia lives in drinking water
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: shigella dysentery is less common and usually human in origin
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: cholera is rare in western countries
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: it is more common in travelers and is usually related to contaminated water its ultimate source is probably sea water
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: escherichia coli is probably a very common cause of diarrhea especially in travelers but it can be difficult to detect using current technology
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the types of e coli vary from area to area and country to country
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: viruses particularly rotavirus are common in children
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: viral diarrhea is probably over diagnosed by non doctors
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the norwalk virus is rare
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: toxins and food poisoning can cause diarrhea
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: these include staphylococcal toxin often from milk products due to an infected wound in workers and bacillus cereus eg rice in chinese takeaways
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: often food poisoning is really salmonella infection
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: diarrhea can also be caused by ingesting foods that contain indigestible material for instance escolar and olestra
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: parasites and worms sometime cause diarrhea but are often accompanied by weight loss irritability rashes or anal itching
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the most common is pinworm mostly of nuisance value rather than a severe medical illness
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: other worms such as hookworm ascaria and tapeworm are more medically significant and may cause weight loss anemia general unwellness and allergy problems
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: amoebic dysentery due to entamoeba histolytica is an important cause of bloody diarrhea in travelers and also sometimes in western countries which requires appropriate and complete medical treatment
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: it is not uncommon for diarrhea to persist
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: diarrhea due to some organisms may persist for years without significant long term illness
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: more commonly a diarrhea will slowly ameliorate but the patient becomes a carrier harbors the infection without illness
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: this is often an indication for treatment especially in food workers or institution workers
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: parasites worms and amoeba should always be treated
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: salmonella is the most common persistent bacterial organism in humans
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: these tend to be more severe medical illnesses
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: malabsorption is the inability to absorb food mostly in the small bowel but also due to the pancreas
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: causes include celiac disease intolerance to gluten a wheat product lactose intolerance intolerance to milk sugar common in non europeans fructose malabsorption pernicious anemia impaired bowel function due to the inability to absorb vitamin b12 loss of pancreatic secretions may be due to cystic fibrosis or pancreatitis short bowel syndrome surgically removed bowel radiation fibrosis usually following cancer treatment and other drugs such as chemotherapy
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the two overlapping types here are of unknown origin
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: irritable bowel syndrome is of unknown origin but often results from an insult to the gut and as such can overlap with infective diarrhea celiac and inflammatory bowel diseases
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: ibs is a brain gut dysfunction that causes visceral hypersensitivity and results in chronic diarrhea or constipation in association with lower abdominal pain or discomfort
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: while there is no direct treatment for the underlying pathology of ibs symptoms including diarrhea can be well managed through a combination of dietary changes soluble fiber supplements and or medications
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: gut directed hypnotherapy is also a very promising avenue of treatment
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: parangkat nu ngagunakeun versi standar usb mana wae oge bisa dipake dina parangkat nu dirancang dina spesifikasi samemehna disebut kasaluyuan ka tukang basa inggris:backwards compatibility
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: dina 2 agustus 2006 spesifikasi ieu nepi ka revisi 1.2
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: usb ngahubungkeun sababaraha parangkat ka host controller ngaliwatan rante hub
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: dina istilah usb parangkat dirujuk minangka fungsi function sabab dina tiori anu ku urang dipikawanoh minangka parangkat sabenerna bisa jadi tempat sababaraha fungsi saperti router anu bisa jadi mangrupa pamaca secure digital card dina waktu nu sarua
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: hub hub mangrupa parangkat nu boga guna husus nu henteu sacara resmi dianggap fungsi
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: nu sok aya wae teh hiji hub minangka root hub nu dipasang langsung kana host controller
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: alat fungsi jeung hub ieu boga pipa kanal logis nyambung nu mangrupa sambungan ti kadali host kana hiji entitas logis dina alat nu disebut titik tungtung endpoint
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: pipah ieu sarua jeung aliran bita byte stream kawas dina jalur pipa pipeline bogana unix nu mana istilah endpoint oge istilah nu goreng dipake keur ngamaksudkeun kana sakabeh pipa sok sanajan dina dokumentasi usb standar oge
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: titik tungtung ieu sarta pipa nu patuturutna dinomeran 0-15 dina unggal arahna antukna hiji alat fungsi bisa boga tepikeun ka 32 pipah aktip 16 ka jero jeung 16 ka luar
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: arah out bisa dihartikeun kaluar tina host controller sarta arah in hartina asup kana host controller unggal titik tungtung bisa nransfer data ukur saarah boh ka jero atawa ka luareun alat fungsi antukna unggal pipa mangrupa pipa saarah
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: titik tungtung 0 disadiakeun keur manajemen beus dua arah sarta jadina aya 32 titik tungtung - sakabeh alat usb kudu nerapkeun titik tungtung 0 antukna pasti ukur aya pipa asup jeung kaluar nu dinomeran 0 dina alat nu siga kumaha wae oge
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: dina pipah ieu data dikirimkeun mangupa paket nu panjangna rupa rupa
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: unggal pipah boga hiji panjang paket makimum ilaharna bita antukna paket usb bakal mindeng ngandung hiji hal anu runtuyanana 8 16 32 64 128 256 512 atawa 1024 bita
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: pipah eta dibagi oge jadi opat kategori nu beda-beda dumasar kana tipe transferna the host controller then polls the bus for traffic usually in a round robin fashion so no device can transfer any data on the bus without explicit request from the host controller
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the interrupt transfers on corresponding endpoints do not actually interrupt any traffic on the bus they are just scheduled to be queried more often and in between any other large transfers thus interrupt traffic on a usb bus is really only high priority traffic
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: to access an endpoint a hierarchical configuration must be obtained
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the device connected to the bus has one and only one device descriptor which in turn has one or more configuration descriptors
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: these configurations often correspond to states e.g active vs low power mode
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: each configuration descriptor in turn has one or more interface descriptors which describe certain aspects of the device so that it may be used for different purposes for example a camera may have both audio and video interfaces
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: these interface descriptors in turn have one default interface setting and possibly more alternate interface settings which in turn have endpoint descriptors as outlined above
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: an endpoint may however be reused among several interfaces and alternate interface settings
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the hardware that contains the host controller and the root hub has an interface toward the programmer which is called host controller device hcd and is defined by the hardware implementer
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: in practice these are hardware registers ports in the computer
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: at version 1.0 and 1.1 there were two competing hcd implementations
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: compaq's open host controller interface ohci was adopted as the standard by the usb if
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: however intel subsequently created a specification they called the universal host controller interface uhci and insisted other implementers pay to license and implement uhci
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: via technologies licensed the uhci standard from intel all other chipset implementers use ohci
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the main difference between ohci and uhci is the fact that uhci is more software driven than ohci is making uhci slightly more processor intensive but cheaper to implement excluding the license fees
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the dueling implementations forced operating system vendors and hardware vendors to develop and test on both implementations which increased cost
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: during the design phase of usb 2.0 the usb if insisted on only one implementation
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the usb 2.0 hcd implementation is called the extended host controller interface ehci
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: only ehci can support high speed transfers
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: each ehci controller contains four virtual hcd implementations to support full speed and low speed devices
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the virtual hcd on intel and via ehci controllers are uhci
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: all other vendors use virtual ohci controllers
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: on microsoft windows platforms one can tell whether a usb port is version 2.0 by opening the device manager and checking for the word enhanced in its description only usb 2.0 drivers will contain the word enhanced on linux systems the lspci v command will list all pci devices and a controllers will be named ohci uhci or ehci respectively which is also the case in the mac os x system profiler
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: on bsd systems dmesg will show the detailed information hierarchy
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: devices that attach to the bus can be full custom devices requiring a full custom device driver to be used or may belong to a device class
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: these classes define an expected behavior in terms of device and interface descriptors so that the same device driver may be used for any device that claims to be a member of a certain class
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: an operating system is supposed to implement all device classes so as to provide generic drivers for any usb device
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: device classes are decided upon by the device working group of the usb implementers forum
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: if the class is to be set for the entire device the number is assigned to the bdeviceclass field of the device descriptor and if it is to be set for a single interface on a device it is assigned to the binterfaceclass field of the interface descriptor
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: both of these are a single byte each so a maximum of 253 different device classes are possible values 0x00 and 0xff are reserved
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: if bdeviceclass is set to 0x00 the operating system will look at binterfaceclass of each interface to determine the device class
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: each class also optionally supports a subclass and protocol subdefinition
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: these can be used as the main device classes are continuously revised
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: kelas alat nu sering dipake dikelompokkeun dumasar id kelas nu didaptarkeun nyaeta
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: nomer suku ditempo dina soket usb signals are transmitted on a twisted pair of data cables labelled d+ and d−
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: these collectively use half duplex differential signaling to combat the effects of electromagnetic noise on longer lines
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: d+ and d− operate together they are not separate simplex connections
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: transmitted signal levels are 0.0-0.3 v for low and 2.8-3.6 v for high
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: usb supports three data rates
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: hi speed devices should fall back to the slower data rate of full speed when plugged into a full speed hub
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: hi speed hubs have a special function called the transaction translator that segregates full speed and low speed bus traffic from hi speed traffic
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the transaction translator in a hi speed hub or possibly each port depending on the electrical design will function as a completely separate full speed bus to full speed and low speed devices attached to it
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: this segregation is for bandwidth only bus rules about power and hub depth still apply
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: a hub will have one or more transaction translators and there is no standard way to determine the number of transaction translators a hub may have
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: all low and full speed devices connected to one transaction translator will share the low full speed bandwidth
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: this means that hubs can have dramatically different performance depending upon the number of transaction translators and the devices plugged into their ports
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: e.g a hi speed 7 port hub with only 1 transaction translator with 7 low full speed devices plugged in will act no differently than a usb 1.1 hub and all devices compete for the same low full speed bandwidth
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: if the hub were to have a transaction translator for each of the seven ports then each device would have all the full low speed bandwidth available to it and would only compete for the hi speed bandwidth which is much greater
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the usb standard uses the nrzi system to encode data and uses bit stuffing for logic 1 transmission more than five bits long put 0 logic after five bits of logic 1)nrzi non-return to zero inverted encoding method does not change the signal for transmission of a logic 1 but the signal level is inverted for each change to a logic 0
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: >most of the pins of a mini usb connector are the same as those in a standard usb connector except pin 4
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: pin 4 is called id and in the mini a connector is connected to ground but in the mini b is not connected
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: this causes a device supporting usb on the go with a mini ab socket to initially act as host when connected to a usb mini a connector the a end of a mini a mini b cable
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the mini a connector also has an additional piece of plastic inside to prevent insertion into a slave only b-only device
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: there are several types of usb connectors and some have been added as the specification has progressed
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: from the original usb specification there is a limited set of cables allowed by the usb specification
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: cables fall into two categories - "detachable and captive
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: for purposes of the specification captive includes any cable with a custom connector on the device end
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: any captive cable has only a type a plug either standard a or mini a
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: any detachable usb cable has one type a connector either standard a or mini a and one type b connector either standard b or mini b
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: detachable usb cable types note that only full-speed and high-speed devices use detachable cables
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: low speed devices only use captive cables because the low speed specification does not allow for the electrical characteristics of standard detachable usb cables
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the mini a mini b and mini ab connectors are used for smaller devices such as pdas mobile phones or digital cameras
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the series a plug is approximately 4 by 12 mm the series b approximately 7 by 8 mm and the mini a and mini b plugs approximately 3 by 7 mm.the connectors which the usb committee specified were designed to support a number of usb's underlying goals and to reflect lessons learned from the varied menagerie of connectors then in service
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: in particular an extension to usb called usb on the go allows a single port to act as either a host or a device chosen by which end of the cable plugs into the socket on the unit
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: even after the cable is hooked up and the units are talking the two units may swap ends under program control
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: this facility targets units such as pdas where the usb link might connect to a pc's host port as a device in one instance yet connect as a host itself to a keyboard and mouse device in another instance
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: usb on the go has therefore defined two small form factor connectors the mini a and mini b and a universal socket mini-ab which should stop the proliferation of proprietary designs
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: wireless usb is a standard being developed to extend the usb standard while maintaining backwards compatibility with usb 1.1 and usb 2.0 on the protocol level
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the maximum length of a usb cable is 5 meters greater lengths require hubs
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the usb specification provides a 5 v supply on a single wire from which connected usb devices may draw power
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the specification allows no more than 5.25 v and no less than 4.375 v initially a device is only allowed to draw 100 ma it may request more current from the upstream device in units of 100 ma up to a maximum of 500 ma in practice most ports will deliver the full 500 ma or more before shutting down power even if the device hasn't requested it or even identified itself but any device that behaves in this way is by definition not a usb device
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: if a compliant device requires more power than is available then it cannot operate until the user changes the network either by rearranging usb connections or by adding external power to supply the power required
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: if a bus powered hub is used the devices downstream may only use a total of four units - 400 ma - of current
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: this limits compliant bus powered hubs to 4 ports among other things
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: equipment requiring more than 500 ma hubs with more than 4 ports and hubs with downstream devices using more than four 100 ma units total must provide their own power
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the host operating system typically keeps track of the power requirements of the usb network and may warn the computer's operator when a given segment requires more power than is available
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: a number of devices use this power supply without participating in a proper usb network
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the typical example is a usb powered reading light fans battery chargers particularly for mobile telephones and even miniature vacuum cleaners are also available
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: in most cases these items contain no electronic circuitry and thus are not proper usb devices at all
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: this can cause problems with some computers the usb specification requires that devices connect in a low power mode 100 ma maximum and state how much current they need before switching with the host's permission into high power mode
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: some usb devices draw more power than is permitted by the specification for a single port
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: this is a common requirement of external hard and optical disc drives and other devices with motors or lamps
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: such devices can be used with an external power supply of adequate rating some external hubs may in practice supply sufficient power
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: for portable devices where external power is not available but not more than 1 a is required at 5 v devices may have connectors to allow the use of two usb cables doubling available power but reducing the number of usb ports available to other devices
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: amongst others a number of peripherals for ibm laptops now made by lenovo are designed to use dual usb connections
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: usb powered devices attempting to draw large currents without requesting the power will not work with certain usb controllers and will either disrupt other devices on the bus or fail to work themselves or both
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: those problems with the abuse of the usb power supply have inspired a number of april fool hoaxes like the introduction of a usb powered george foreman igrill and a desktop usb fondue set
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: there are also unique and unusual usb powered devices such as food drives coffee warmers bbqs to lifestyle accessories and more
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: usb implements connections to storage devices using a set of standards called the usb mass storage device class
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: this was initially intended for traditional magnetic and optical drives but has been extended to support a wide variety of devices
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: usb is not intended to be a primary bus for a computer's internal storage buses such as ata ide and scsi fulfill that role
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: however usb has one important advantage in making it possible to install and remove devices without opening the computer case making it useful for external drives
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: today a number of manufacturers offer external portable usb hard drives or empty enclosures for drives that offer performance comparable to internal drives
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: these external drives usually contain a translating device that interfaces a drive of conventional technology ide ata sata atapi or even scsi to a usb port
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: functionally the drive appears to the user just like another internal drive
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: as of 2006 most pcs and motherboards have at least two usb ports but still retain ps/2 keyboard and mouse connectors
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: at keyboard connectors are less frequently found
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: motherboards for non portable pcs usually have a number of usb 2.0 high speed ports some available at the back of the computer case others requiring usb sockets on the front or rear of the computer to be connected via a cable to a header on the motherboard
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: joysticks keypads tablets and other human interface devices are also progressively migrating from midi pc game port and ps/2 connectors to usb
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: mice and keyboards are frequently fitted with usb connectors but are generally supplied with a small usb to ps/2 adaptor so that they can be used with either usb or ps/2 ports
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: apple computers have used usb mice and keyboards exclusively since january 1999
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: usb was originally seen as a complement to firewire which was designed as a high speed serial bus which could efficiently interconnect peripherals such as hard disks audio interfaces and video equipment
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: usb originally operated at a far lower data rate and used much simpler hardware and was suitable for small peripherals such as keyboards and mice
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: however firewire ports were more costly to implement than usb ports in part due to their per port license fee between 75 cents and $1.50 in bulk licenses and the more complex circuitry the controller required
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: as a result they were rarely provided as standard equipment on computers other than apple's macintoshes apple owns rights to the firewire standard and peripheral manufacturers offered many more usb devices
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the introduction of usb 2.0 hi speed with its widely advertised 480 mbit s signaling rate convinced many consumers that firewire was outdated although this was not necessarily the case see usb 2.0 hi speed vs firewire below
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: today usb hi speed is rapidly replacing firewire in consumer products
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: firewire retains its popularity in many professional settings where it is used for audio and video transfer and data storage
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the most significant technical differences between firewire and usb include the following
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the signalling rate of usb 2.0 hi speed mode is 480 megabits per second while the signalling rate of firewire 400 ieee 1394a is 393.216 mbit s
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: usb requires more host processing power than firewire due to the need for the host to provide the arbitration and scheduling of transactions
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: usb transfer rates are theoretically higher than firewire due to the need for firewire devices to arbitrate for bus access
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: a single firewire device may achieve a transfer rate for firewire 400 as high as 41 mb/s
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: while for usb 2.0 the rate can theoretically be 55 mb/s for a single device
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: in a multi device environment firewire rapidly loses ground to usb firewire's mixed speed networks and long connection chains dramatically affect its performance
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the peer to peer nature of firewire requires devices to arbitrate which means a firewire bus must wait until a given signal has propagated to all devices on the bus
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the more devices on the bus the lower the peak performance
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: conversely for usb the maximum timing model is fixed and is limited only by the host device branch not the entire network
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: furthermore the host centric nature of usb allows the host to allocate more bandwidth to high priority devices instead of forcing them to compete for bandwidth as in firewire
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: despite all this and despite usb's theoretically higher speed in real life benchmarks the actual speed of firewire hard drives nearly always beats usb 2 hard drives by a significant margin
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: in addition to this some operating systems take a conservative approach to scheduling transactions and limit the number of transfers per frame reducing the maximum transfers from say the theoretical 13 per frame to 10 or 9
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: in 2003 firewire was updated with the ieee 1394b specification
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: this provides a new mode called s800 which operates at 786.432 mbit s
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: s800 requires a new physical layer but s800 nodes can be connected to existing firewire 1394a ports just as usb hi speed nodes will operate with older full speed hosts
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: however unlike usb hi speed systems which can change the speeds on each branch a 1394a device on a 1394b system requires all devices to fall to 1394a speeds
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: ieee 1394b also provides rates up to approximately 3.2 gbit s however the higher rates use special physical layers which are incompatible with 1394a devices
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: released on may 12 2005
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: wireless usb uses uwb ultra wide band as the radio technology
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the pictbridge standard allows for interconnecting consumer imaging devices
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: it typically uses usb as the underlying communication layer
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: microsoft's xbox game console uses standard usb 1.1 signalling in its controllers but features a proprietary connector rather than the standard usb connector
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: however microsoft uses standard usb 2.0 connectivity in its newer xbox 360 similarly ibm ultraport uses standard usb signalling but uses a proprietary connection format
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: powered usb uses standard usb signalling with the addition of extra power lines for point of sale terminals
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the usb implementers forum is working on a wireless networking standard based on the usb protocol
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: wireless usb is intended as a cable replacement technology and will use ultra wideband wireless technology for data rates of up to 480 mbit s
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: wireless usb is well suited to wireless connection of pc centric devices just as bluetooth is now widely used for mobile phone centric personal networks at much lower data rates
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: see http://www.usb.org/developers/wusb/ for more details
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: a company called fiberbyte have developed an open industry software specification called usb insync which allows real time control of multiple usb devices
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the standard usb interface is asynchronous which leads to poor control of temporal parameters
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: see http://www.fiberbyte.com/usbinsync.htm for more details
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: communication between software and usb devices usually depends upon the operating system windows macintosh linux etc and the language you choose java c++ delphi etc
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: one exception is the libusb project which provides a common library interface for use under multiple operating systems
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: * general poseidon are commercial drivers for usb
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: if your operating system and language combination is not supported another option is a usb to rs 232 bridge
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: ftdi chip provides virtual com drivers with its chips to make the usb device look to the host software like a com rs-232 port
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: alternatively microchip offers com port emulation firmware for their range of usb pic microcontrollers
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the engineer must identify and understand the relevant constraints in order to produce a successful design
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: constraints include available resources physical or technical limitations flexibility for future modifications and additions and other factors such as requirements for cost manufacturability serviceability and marketing and aesthetic social or ethic considerations
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: by understanding the constraints engineers deduce specifications for the limits within which an object or system may be produced and operated
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: engineering is therefore influenced by many considerations
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: engineers use their knowledge of science and mathematics and appropriate experience to find suitable solutions to a problem
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: creating an appropriate mathematical model of a problem allows them to analyze it perhaps but exceptionally definitively and to test potential solutions
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: if multiple reasonable solutions exist engineers evaluate the different design choices on their merits and choose the solution that best meets the requirements
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: engineers typically attempt to predict how well their designs will perform to their specifications prior to full scale production
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: they use among other things prototypes scale models simulations destructive tests nondestructive testing and stress tests
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: testing ensures that products will perform as expected
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: engineers as professionals take seriously their responsibility to produce designs that will perform as expected and will not cause unintended harm to the public at large
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: engineers typically include a factor of safety in their designs to reduce the risk of unexpected failure
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: computers and design software play an increasingly important role
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: using computer aided design cad software engineers are able to capture more information about their designs
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the computer can automatically translate some models to instructions suitable for automatic machinery e.g cnc to fabricate part of a design
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the computer also allows increased reuse of previously developed designs by presenting an engineer with a library of predefined parts ready to be used in designs
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: additionally engineers make use of a variety of circuit schematics software to aid in the creation of circuit designs that perform an electronic task when used for a printed circuit board pcb or a computer chip
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: science attempts to explain newly observed and unexplained phenomena often creating mathematical models of observed phenomena
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: technology and engineering are attempts at practical application of knowledge often from science
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: scientists work on science engineers work on technology
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: however there is often an overlap between science and engineering
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: it is not uncommon for scientists to become involved in the practical application of their discoveries thereby becoming for the moment engineers
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: conversely in the process of developing technology engineers sometimes find themselves exploring new phenomena thus becoming for the moment scientists
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: there are significant parallels between the practice of medicine and engineering

lines.value: both professions are well known for their pragmatism the solution to real world problems often requires moving forward before phenomenea are completely understood in a more rigorous scientific sense

lines.value: the term statesman is a respectful term used to refer to diplomats politicians and other notable figures of state
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: it is often used in the context of international or foreign affairs e.g a meeting of statesmen foreign ministers are often called statesmen for example while more local level officials such as mayors are not
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: whether or not an individual actually is a statesman is generally a matter of opinion although in some cases there is little controversy
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: politicians who are regarded as statesmen are usually old with long careers
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the term most frequently refers to individuals associated with a governmental shift from monarchism to republicanism
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: geneally one can use the word as a euphemism for politician

lines.value: when a politician retires he is often referred to as a respected elder statesman by his supporters

lines.value: tingal big bang theory jeung stellar evolution they range in size from the tiny neutron stars which are actually dead stars no bigger than a city to supergiants like the north star polaris and betelgeuse in the orion constellation which have a diameter about 1000 times larger than the sun -about 1.6 terametres
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: however these have a much lower density than the sun
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: one of the most massive stars known is n carinae with 100 150 times as much mass as the sun
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: recent work by donald figer an astronomer at the space telescope science institute in baltimore maryland suggests that 150 solar masses is the upper limit of stars in the current era of the universe
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: he used the hubble space telescope to observe about a thousand stars in the arches cluster a massive young star cluster near the core of the milky way and found no stars over that limit despite a statistical expectation that there should be several
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the reason for this limit is not precisely known but the eddington limit is part of the answer
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the very first stars to form after the big bang may have been larger up to 300 solar masses or more due to the complete absence of elements heavier than lithium in their composition
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: this generation of supermassive star is long extinct however and currently only theoretical
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: with a mass only 93 times that of jupiter ab doradus c a companion to ab doradus a is the smallest known star undergoing nuclear fusion in its core
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: smaller bodies are brown dwarfs which occupy a poorly defined grey area between stars and gas giants
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the minimum mass a star can have is estimated to be in the vicinity of 75 jupiters
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the energy produced by stars radiates into space as electromagnetic radiation as a stream of neutrinos from the star's core and as a stream of particles from the star's outer layers its stellar wind
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the peak frequency of the light depends on the temperature of the outer layers of the star
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: besides the emitted visible light the ultraviolet and infrared components are typically significant
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the apparent brightness of a star is measured by its apparent magnitude
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the nearest star to the earth apart from the sun is proxima centauri which is 39.9 trillion kilometers or 4.2 light years away light from proxima centauri takes 4.2 years to reach earth
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: travelling at the orbit speed of the space shuttle 5 miles per second almost 30000 kilometers per hour it would take about 150000 years to get there
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: distances like this are typical inside galactic discs where the sun and earth are located
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: stars can be much closer to each other in the centres of galaxies and globular clusters or much further apart in galactic halos
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: star formation occurs in molecular clouds large regions of high density in the interstellar medium though still less dense than the inside of an earthly vacuum chamber
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: star formation begins with gravitational instability inside those clouds often triggered by shockwaves from supernovae or collision of two galaxies as in a starburst galaxy
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: high mass stars powerfully illuminate the clouds from which they formed
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: one example of such a nebula is the orion nebula
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: stars spend about 90% of their lifetime fusing hydrogen to produce helium in high temperature and high pressure reactions near the core
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: such stars are said to be on the main sequence
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: small stars called red dwarfs burn their fuel very slowly and last tens to hundreds of billions of years
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: at the end of their lives they simply become dimmer and dimmer fading into black dwarfs
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: however since the lifespan of such stars is greater than the current age of the universe 13.6 billion years no black dwarfs exist yet
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: as most stars exhaust their supply of hydrogen their outer layers expand and cool to form a red giant
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: in about 5 billion years when the sun is a red giant it will be so large that it will consume both mercury and venus
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: eventually the core is compressed enough to start helium fusion and the star heats up and contracts
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: larger stars will also fuse heavier elements all the way to iron which is the end point of the process
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: since iron nuclei are more tightly bound than any heavier nuclei they cannot be fused to release energy
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: likewise since they are more tightly bound than all lighter nuclei energy cannot be released by fission
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: in old very massive stars a large core of inert iron will accumulate in the center of the star
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: an average size star will then shed its outer layers as a planetary nebula
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the core that remains will be a tiny ball of degenerate matter not massive enough for further fusion to take place supported only by degeneracy pressure called a white dwarf
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: these too will fade into black dwarfs over very long stretches of time
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: in larger stars fusion continues until an iron core accumulates that is too large to be supported by electron degeneracy pressure
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: this core will suddenly collapse as its electrons are driven into its protons forming neutrons and neutrinos in a burst of inverse beta decay
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the shockwave formed by this sudden collapse causes the rest of the star to explode in a supernova
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: supernovae are so bright that they may briefly outshine the star's entire home galaxy
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: when they occur within the milky way supernovae have historically been observed by naked eye observers as new stars where none existed before
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: eventually most of the matter in a star is blown away by the explosion forming nebulae such as the crab nebula and what remains will be a neutron star sometimes a pulsar or x ray burster or in the case of the largest stars a black hole
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the blown off outer layers of dying stars include heavy elements which may be recycled during new star formation
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: these heavy elements allow the formation of rocky planets
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the outflow from supernovae and the stellar wind of large stars play an important part in shaping the interstellar medium
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: stellar evolution explains how stars are created and die in greater detail
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: there are different classifications of stars ranging from type w which are very large and bright to m which is often just large enough to start ignition of the hydrogen
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: some of the more common classifications are o b a f g k m and can perhaps be more easily remembered using the mnemonic oh be a fine girl kiss me variant change girl to guy invented by annie jump cannon 1863-1941
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: there are many other mnemonics for star classification the most frequent addition tacks right now sweetheart for the red dwarf sub types r n and s the new types l and t have also been recently appended to the end of the obafgkm sequence to classify the coldest low mass stars and brown dwarfs prompting such additions as lovingly tonight to the mnemonic
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: each letter has 9 subclassifications
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: our sun is a g2 which is very near the middle in terms of quantities observed
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: most stars fall into the main sequence which is a description of stars based on their absolute magnitude and spectral type
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the sun is taken as the prototypical star not because it is special in any way but because it is the closest and most studied star we have and most characteristics of other stars are usually given in solar units
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: for example the mass of the sun is :m sun = 1.9891x10 30 kg the masses of other stars can be given in terms of m sun
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: most stars are identified only by catalogue numbers only a few have names as such
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the names are either traditional names mostly from arabic flamsteed designations or bayer designations
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the only body which has been recognized by the scientific community as having competence to name stars or other celestial bodies is the international astronomical union iau
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: a number of private companies e.g the international star registry purport to sell names to stars however these names are not recognized by the scientific community nor used by them and many in the astronomy community view these organizations as frauds preying on people ignorant of how stars are in fact named
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: see star designations for more information on how stars are named
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: for a list of traditional names see the list of stars by constellation
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: a variety of different nuclear fusion reactions take place inside the cores of stars depending upon their mass and composition see stellar nucleosynthesis
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: stars begin as a cloud of mostly hydrogen with about 25% helium and heavier elements in smaller quantities
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: in the sun with a 10 7 k core hydrogen fuses to form helium in the proton proton chain :4 1 h → 4 he + 2e + + 2y + 2v e 26.7 mev in more massive stars helium is produced in a cycle of reactions catalyzed by carbon the carbon nitrogen oxygen cycle
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: in stars with cores at 10 8 k and masses between 0.5 and 10 solar masses helium can be transformed into carbon in the triple alpha process :3 4 he → 12 c + y + 7.2 mev
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: as well as certain constellations and the sun itself stars as a whole have their own mythology
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: they were thought to be the souls of the dead or gods goddesses

lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: each of these estimation methods is sensitive to different sources of error and so might not be expected to be equal
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: also reliability is a property of the scores of a measure rather than the measure itself and are thus said to be sample dependent
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: reliability estimates from one sample might differ from those of a second sample beyond what might be expected due to sampling variations if the second sample is drawn from a different population because the true reliability is different in this second population
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: this is true of measures of all types--yardsticks might measure houses well yet have poor reliability when used to measure the lengths of insects reliability may be improved by clarity of expression for written assessments lengthening the measure and other informal means
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: however formal psychometric analysis called the item analysis is considered the most effective way to increase reliability
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: this analysis consists of computation of item difficulties and item discrimination indices the later index involving computation of correlations between the items and sum of the item scores of the entire test
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: in classical test theory reliability is defined mathematically as the ratio of the variation of the true score and the variation of the observed score
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: or equivalently one minus the ratio of the variation of the error score and the variation of the observed score : are the variances on the measured true and error scores respectively
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: unfortunately there is no way to directly observe or calculate the true score so a variety of methods are used to estimate the reliability of a test
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: some examples of the methods to estimate reliability include test retest reliability internal consistency reliability and parallel test reliability
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: each method comes at the problem of figuring out the source of error in the test somewhat differently
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: it was well known to classical test theorists that measurement precision is not uniform across the scale of measurement
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: tests tend to distinguish better for test takers with moderate trait levels and worse among high and low scoring test takers
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: item response theory extends the concept of reliability from a single index to a function called the information function
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the irt information function is the inverse of the conditional observed score standard error at any given test score
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: higher levels of irt information indicate higher precision and thus greater reliability.->
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: a new worker spends the first few days of its adult life caring for the queen and young
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: after that it graduates to digging and other nest work and then to foraging and defense of the nest
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: these changes are fairly abrupt and define what are called temporal castes
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: one theory of why this occurs is because foraging has a high death rate so ants only participate in it when they are older and closer to death anyway
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: in a few ants there are also physical castes workers come in a spectrum of sizes called minor median and major workers the latter beginning foraging sooner
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: often the larger ants will have disproportionately larger heads and so stronger mandibles
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: such individuals are sometimes called soldier ants because their stronger mandibles make them more effective in fighting other creatures although they are still in fact worker ants and their duties typically do not vary greatly from the minor or median workers
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: in a few species the median workers have disappeared creating a sharp divide and clear physical difference between the minors and majors
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: most of the common ant species breed in the same way
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: all ants in the colonies are females to begin with but only the queen and breeding females have the ability to mate
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: contrary to popular belief some ant nests have multiple queens
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the male ants called drones along with the breeding females are born with wings and do nothing throughout their life except eat at least until the time for mating comes
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: at this time all the breeding ants in the colony are carried outside save for the queen where other colonies of similar species are doing the same
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: then all the winged breeding ants take flight
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: mating occurs in flight and the males die shortly afterward
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the females that survive land and seek a suitable place to begin a colony
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: there they break off their own wings and begin to lay eggs which they care for
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: sperm obtained during their nuptial flight is stored and used to fertilise all future eggs produced
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the first workers to hatch are weak and smaller than later workers but they begin to serve the colony immediately
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: they enlarge the nest forage for food and care for the other eggs
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: this is how a new colony starts.-->
