lines.value: <!this configuration can only occur during a new moon when the sun and moon are in conjunction as seen from the earth
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: in ancient times and in some cultures today solar eclipses are attributed to mythical properties
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: total solar eclipses can be frightening events for people unaware of their astronomical nature as the sun suddenly disappears in the middle of the day and the sky darkens in a matter of minutes
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: however the spiritual attribution of solar eclipses is now largely disregarded
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: total solar eclipses are very rare events for any given place on earth because totality is only seen where the moon's umbra touches the earth's surface
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: a total solar eclipse is a spectacular natural phenomenon and many people consider travel to remote locations in order to observe one
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the 1999 total eclipse in europe said by some to be the most watched eclipse in human history helped to increase public awareness of the phenomenon
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: this was illustrated by the number of people willing to make the trip to witness the 2005 annular eclipse and the 2006 total eclipse
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the next total solar eclipse will occur on august 1 2008
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: there are four types of solar eclipses because the moon's orbit around the earth is an ellipse the moon's distance from the earth varies so the apparent sizes of the sun and moon likewise vary
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the magnitude of an eclipse is the ratio of the apparent size of the moon to the apparent size of the sun during an eclipse
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: an eclipse when the moon is near its closest distance from the earth i.e near its perigee will be a total eclipse because the moon will appear to be large enough to cover completely the sun's bright disk or photosphere a total eclipse has a magnitude greater than 1
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: conversely an eclipse when the moon is near its farthest distance from the earth i.e near its apogee will be an annular eclipse because the moon will appear to be slightly smaller than the sun the magnitude of an annular eclipse is less than 1
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: slightly more solar eclipses are annular than total because on average the moon lies too far away from earth to cover the sun completely
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: a hybrid eclipse occurs when the magnitude of an eclipse is very close to 1 the eclipse will appear to be total at some locations on earth and annular at other locations
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the earth's orbit around the sun is also elliptical so the earth's distance from the sun varies throughout the year
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: this also affects the apparent sizes of the sun and moon but not so much as the earth's varying distance from the moon
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: when the earth approaches its farthest distance from the sun the aphelion in july this tends to favor a total eclipse
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: as the earth approaches its closest distance from the sun the perihelion in january this tends to favor an annular eclipse
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: central eclipse is often used as a generic term for a total annular or hybrid eclipse
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: this is however not completely correct the definition of a central eclipse is an eclipse during which the central line of the umbra touches the earth's surface
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: it is possible though extremely rare that part of the umbra intersects with earth thus creating an annular or total eclipse but not its central line
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: this is then called a non central total or annular eclipse
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the term solar eclipse itself is technically a misnomer
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the phenomenon of the moon passing in front of the sun is not an eclipse but an occultation
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: properly speaking an eclipse occurs when one object passes into the shadow cast by another object
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: for example when the moon disappears at full moon by passing into earth's shadow the event is properly called a lunar eclipse
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: therefore the proper but rarely used term for what is commonly called a solar eclipse is eclipse of the earth
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the diagram to the right shows the alignment of the sun moon and earth during a solar eclipse
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the dark gray region below the moon is the umbra where the sun is completely obscured by the moon
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the small area where the umbra touches the earth's surface is where a total eclipse can be seen
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the larger light gray area is the penumbra in which only a partial eclipse can be seen
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the moon's orbit around the earth is inclined at an angle of just over 5 degrees to the plane of the earth's orbit around the sun the ecliptic
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: because of this at the time of a new moon the moon will usually pass above or below the sun
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: a solar eclipse can occur only when the new moon occurs close to one of the points known as nodes where the moon's orbit crosses the ecliptic
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: as noted above the moon's orbit is also elliptical
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the moon's distance from the earth can vary by about 6% from its average value
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: therefore the moon's apparent size varies with its distance from the earth and it is this effect that leads to the difference between total and annular eclipses
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the distance of the earth from the sun also varies during the year but this is a smaller effect
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: on average the moon appears to be slightly smaller than the sun so the majority about 60% of central eclipses are annular
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: it is only when the moon is closer to the earth than average near its perigee that a total eclipse occurs
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the moon orbits the earth in approximately 27.3 days relative to a fixed frame of reference
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: this is known as the sidereal month
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: however during one sidereal month the earth has revolved around the sun making the average time between one new moon and the next longer than the sidereal month it is approximately 29.6 days
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: this is known as the synodic month and corresponds to what is commonly called the lunar month
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the moon crosses from south to north of the ecliptic at its ascending node
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: however the nodes of the moon's orbit are gradually moving in a retrograde motion due to the action of the sun's gravity on the moon's motion and they make a complete circuit every 18.5 years
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: this means that the time between each passage of the moon through the ascending node is slightly shorter than the sidereal month
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: this period is called the draconitic month
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: finally the moon's perigee is moving forwards in its orbit and makes a complete circuit in about 9 years
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the time between one perigee and the next is known as the anomalistic month
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the moon's orbit intersects with the ecliptic at the two nodes that are 180 degrees apart
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: therefore the new moon occurs close to the nodes at two periods of the year approximately six months apart and there will always be at least one solar eclipse during these periods
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: sometimes the new moon occurs close enough to a node during two consecutive months
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: this means that in any given year there will always be at least two solar eclipses and there can be as many as five
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: however some are visible only as partial eclipses because the umbra passes above earth's north or south pole and others are central only in remote regions of the arctic or antarctic
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: during a central eclipse the moon's umbra or antumbra in the case of an annular eclipse moves rapidly from west to east across the earth
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the earth is also rotating from west to east but the umbra always moves faster than any given point on the earth's surface so it almost always appears to move in a roughly west east direction across a map of the earth there are some rare exceptions to this which can occur during an eclipse of the midnight sun in arctic or antarctic regions
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the width of the track of a central eclipse varies according to the relative apparent diameters of the sun and moon
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: in the most favourable circumstances when a total eclipse occurs very close to perigee the track can be over 250 km wide and the duration of totality may be over 7 minutes
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: outside of the central track a partial eclipse can usually be seen over a much larger area of the earth
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: total solar eclipses are rare events
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: although they occur somewhere on earth approximately every 18 months it has been estimated that they recur at any given place only once every 370 years on average
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: then after waiting so long the total eclipse only lasts for a few minutes as the moon's umbra moves eastward at over 1700 km h
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: totality can never last more than 7 min 40 s and is usually much shorter during each millennium there are typically fewer than 10 total solar eclipses exceeding 7 minutes
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the last time this happened was june 30 1973
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: observers aboard a concorde aircraft were able to stretch totality to about 74 minutes by flying along the path of the moon's umbra
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the next eclipse of comparable duration will not occur until june 25 2150
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the longest total solar eclipse during the 8000-year period from 3000 bc to 5000 ad will occur on july 16 2186 when totality will last 7 min 29 s if the date and time of any solar eclipse are known it is possible to predict other eclipses using eclipse cycles
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: two such cycles are the saros and the inex
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the saros cycle is probably the best known and one of the most accurate eclipse cycles
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the inex cycle is itself a poor cycle but it is very convenient in the classification of eclipse cycles
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: after a saros cycle finishes a new saros cycle begins one inex later hence its name in ex a saros cycle lasts 6585.3 days a little over 18 years which means that after this period a practically identical eclipse will occur
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the most notable difference will be a shift of 120° in longitude due to the 0.3 days and a little in latitude
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: a saros series always starts with a partial eclipse at a pole then shifts over the globe through a series of annular or total eclipses and ends on the other pole a couple of millennia later
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: due to tidal acceleration the orbit of the moon around the earth is unstable and becomes approximately 3.8 cm more distant each year
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: it is estimated that in 600 million years the distance from the earth to the moon will have increased by 23500 km meaning that it will no longer be able to completely cover the sun's disk
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: this will be true even when the moon is at perigee and the earth at aphelion
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: a complicating factor is that the sun will increase in size over this timescale
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: this makes it even more unlikely that the moon will be able to cause a total eclipse
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: we can therefore say that the last total solar eclipse on earth will occur in slightly less than 600 million years
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: a solar eclipse of 15 june 763 bc mentioned in an assyrian text is important for the chronology of the ancient orient
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: this is the earliest solar eclipse mentioned in historical sources that has been identified beyond reasonable doubt
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: there have been other claims to date earlier eclipses notably that of mursili ii likely 1312 bc in babylonia and also in china but these are highly disputed and rely on much supposition
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: herodotus wrote that thales of miletus predicted an eclipse which occurred during a war between the medians and the lydians
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: soldiers on both sides put down their weapons and declared peace as a result of the eclipse
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: exactly which eclipse was involved has remained uncertain although the issue has been studied by hundreds of ancient and modern authorities
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: one likely candidate took place on may 28 585 bc probably near the halys river in the middle of modern turkey
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: an annular eclipse of the sun occurred at sardis on february 17 478 bc while xerxes was departing for his expedition against greece as herodotus recorded
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: hind and chambers considered this absolute date more than a century ago
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: herodotus also reports that another solar eclipse was observed in sparta during the next year on august 1 477 bc the sky suddenly darkened in the middle of the day well after the battles of thermopylae and salamis after the departure of mardonius to thessaly at the beginning of the spring of 477 bc and his second attack on athens after the return of cleombrotus to sparta
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: note that the modern conventional dates are different by a year or two and that these two eclipse records have been ignored so far
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: it has also been attempted to establish the exact date of good friday by means of solar eclipses but this research has not yielded conclusive results
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: <div style="background-color:black"> looking directly at the photosphere of the sun the bright disk of the sun itself even for just a few seconds can cause permanent damage to the retina of the eye because of the intense visible and invisible radiation that the photosphere emits
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: this damage can result in permanent impairment of vision up to and including blindness
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the retina has no sensitivity to pain and the effects of retinal damage may not appear for hours so there is no warning that injury is occurring
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: under normal conditions the sun is so bright that it is difficult to stare at it directly so there is no tendency to look at it in a way that might damage the eye
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: however during an eclipse with so much of the sun covered it is easier and more tempting to stare at it
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: unfortunately looking at the sun during an eclipse is just as dangerous as looking at it outside an eclipse except during the brief period of totality when the sun's disk is completely covered totality occurs only during a total eclipse and only very briefly it does not occur during a partial or annular eclipse
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: viewing the sun's disk through any kind of optical aid binoculars a telescope or even an optical camera viewfinder is even more hazardous
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: glancing at the sun with all or most of its disk visible is unlikely to result in permanent harm as the pupil will close down and reduce the brightness of the whole scene
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: if the eclipse is near total the low average amount of light causes the pupil to open
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: unfortunately the remaining parts of the sun are still just as bright so they are now brighter on the retina than when looking at a full sun
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: as the eye has a small fovea for detailed viewing the tendency will be to track the image on to this best part of the retina causing damage
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: viewing the sun during partial and annular eclipses and during total eclipses outside the brief period of totality requires special eye protection or indirect viewing methods
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the sun's disk can be viewed using appropriate filtration to block the harmful part of the sun's radiation
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: sunglasses are not safe since they do not block the harmful and invisible infrared radiation which causes retinal damage
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: only properly designed and certified solar filters should ever be used for direct viewing of the sun's disk
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the safest way to view the sun's disk is by indirect projection
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: this can be done by projecting an image of the disk onto a white piece of paper or card using a pair of binoculars with one of the lenses covered a telescope or another piece of cardboard with a small hole in it about 1 mm diameter often called a pinhole camera
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the projected image of the sun can then be safely viewed this technique can be used to observe sunspots as well as eclipses
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: however care must be taken to ensure that no one looks through the projector telescope pinhole etc directly
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: viewing the sun's disk on a video display screen provided by a video camera or digital camera is safe although the camera itself may be damaged by direct exposure to the sun
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the optical viewfinders provided with some video and digital cameras are not safe
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: contrary to popular belief it is safe to observe the total phase of a solar eclipse directly with the unaided eye binoculars or a telescope when the sun's photosphere is completely covered by the moon indeed this is a very spectacular and beautiful sight and it is too dim to be seen through filters
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the sun's faint corona will be visible and even the chromosphere solar prominences and possibly even a solar flare may be seen
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: however it is important to stop directly viewing the sun promptly at the end of totality
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the exact time and duration of totality for the location from which the eclipse is being observed should be determined from a reliable source
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: also very beautiful are the effects just before and just after totality
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: when the shrinking visible part of the photosphere becomes very small baily beads will occur see picture
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: these are caused by the sunlight still being able to reach earth through lunar valleys but no longer where mountains are present
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: totality then begins with the diamond ring effect the last bright flash of sunlight
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: note that it is not entirely safe to view baily beads or the diamond ring without proper eye protection because in both cases the photosphere is still visible
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: for astronomers a total solar eclipse forms a rare opportunity to observe the corona the outer layer of the sun's atmosphere
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: normally this is not visible because the photosphere is much brighter than the corona
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: according to the point reached in the solar cycle the corona can appear rather small and symmetric or large and fuzzy
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: it is very hard to predict this prior to totality
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: during a solar eclipse special indirect observations can also be done with the unaided eye only
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: normally the spots of light which fall through the small openings between the leaves of a tree have a circular shape
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: these are images of the sun
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: during a partial eclipse the light spots will show the partial shape of the sun as seen on the picture
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: another famous phenomenon is shadow bands also known as flying shadows which are similar to shadows on the bottom of a swimming pool
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: they only occur just prior to and after totality and are very difficult to observe
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: many professional eclipse chasers have never seen them
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: during a partial eclipse a related effect that can be seen is anisotropy in the shadows of objects
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: particularly if the partial eclipse is nearly total the unobscured part of the sun acts as an approximate line source of light
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: this means that objects cast shadows which have a very narrow penumbra in one direction but a broad penumbra in the perpendicular direction
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: in 1919 the observation of a total solar eclipse helped to confirm einstein's theory of general relativity
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: by comparing the apparent distance between two stars with and without the sun between them the theoretical predictions about gravitational lenses were confirmed though the data were ambiguous at the time
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: of course the observation with the sun between was only possible during totality since the stars are visible then
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: over the years some less important special observations took place
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the phenomenon of atmospheric diffraction makes it possible to observe the sun and hence a solar eclipse even when it is slightly below the horizon
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: it is however possible for a solar eclipse to attain totality or in the event of a partial eclipse near totality before visual and actual sunrise or after sunset from a particular location
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: when this occurs shortly before the former or after the latter the sky will appear much darker than it would otherwise be immediately before sunrise or after sunset
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: on these occasions an object especially a planet often mercury may be visible near the sunrise or sunset point of the horizon when it could not have been seen without the eclipse
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: in principle the simultaneous occurrence of a solar eclipse and a transit of a planet is possible
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: but these events are extremely rare because of their short durations
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the next anticipated simultaneous occurrence of a solar eclipse and a transit of mercury will be on july 5 6757 and a solar eclipse and a transit of venus is expected on april 5 15232
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: only 5 hours after the transit of venus on june 4 1769 there was a total solar eclipse which was visible in northern america europe and northern asia as partial solar eclipse
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: this was the lowest time difference between a transit of a planet and a solar eclipse in the historical past
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: more common but still quite rare is a conjunction of any planet not confined exclusively to mercury or venus at the time of a total solar eclipse in which event the planet will be visible very near the eclipsed sun when without the eclipse it would have been lost in the sun's glare
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: at one time some scientists hypothesized that there may be a planet often given the name vulcan even closer to the sun than mercury the only way to confirm its existence would have been to observe it during a total solar eclipse
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: however it is now known that no such planet exists although there remains some possibility for small vulcanoid asteroids to exist although none have ever been found
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: artificial satellites can also get in the line between the earth and the sun but none is large enough to cause an eclipse
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: at the altitude of the international space station for example an object would need to be about 3.35 km across to blot the sun out entirely
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: this means the best you can get is a satellite transit but these events are difficult to watch because the zone of visibility is very small
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the satellite passes over the face of the sun in about a second typically
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: as with a transit of a planet it will not get dark
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: artificial satellites do play an important role in documenting solar eclipses
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: images of the umbra on the earth's surface taken from mir and the international space station are among the most spectacular eclipse images in history
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: observations of eclipses from satellites orbiting above the earth's atmosphere are of course not subject to weather conditions
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the direct observation of a total solar eclipse from space is rather rare
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the only documented case is gemini 12 in 1966
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the partial phase of the 2006 total eclipse was visible from the international space station
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: at first it looked as though an orbit correction in the middle of march would bring the iss in the path of totality but this correction was postponed
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: budaya dunya nu luhur eta geisha disebut karyukai 花柳界 the flower and willow world
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: wanoja nu hayang jadi geisha lolobana mimiti latihan sanggeus tamat smp lolobana sanggeus tamat sma atawa diploma lolobana mimiti karirna dina mangsa dewasa

lines.value: geisha masih diajar alat musik tradisional saperti shamisen shakuhachi suling sarta gendang salian ti nembang tari tradisional jepang acara nginum teh ala jepang sajarah jeung sastra
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: ku cara diajar ti geisha sejen sarta diajarkeun nu boga imah geisha nu dialajar eta bakal mibanda kamampuh tradisi nu kuat dina milih sarta makekimono tur dina ngalayanan pelangganna
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: di kyoto nepi ka kiwari masih nyepeng pageuh tradisi geisha dua tempat prestise jeung wewengkon tradisional gion jeung pontocho
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: di tokyo hanamachi shimbashi asakusa tur kagurazaka oge tempat nu dipikanyaho
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: di jepang mangsa kiwari hese manggihan geisha jeung maiko saluareun kyoto
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: dina taun 1920-an leuwih ti 80000 geisha di jepang tapi kiwari loba ngurangan jumlahna kurang leuwih 10000
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: sanajan kitu wisatawan nu datang ka wewengkon gion kyoto bsa panggih jeung maiko di jalan atawan ku cara janjian
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: ekonomi nu seret nurunkeun minat kana seni tradisional kembang jeung tatangkalan nu huripna teu tangtu tur beaya nu diperlukeun ku geisha jadi sabab nurunna minat kana seni seni tradisional
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: geisha are often hired to attend parties and gatherings traditionally at tea houses 茶屋 chaya or at traditional japanese restaurants ryotei
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: their time is measured in the time it takes an incense stick to burn and is called senkodai 線香代 incense stick fee or gyokudai 玉代 jewel fee
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: in kyoto the terms ohana and hanadai meaning flower fees are preferred
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the customer makes arrangements through the geisha union office 検番 kenban which keeps each geisha's schedule and makes her appointments both for entertaining and for training
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: hanadai 花代 or ohana is the fee for hiring the services of a geisha or maiko
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: this word is used mainly in kyoto while senkodai 線香代 and gyokudai 玉代 are used in tokyo and other parts of japan
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: there remains some confusion particularly outside japan about the nature of the geisha profession
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: this issue has been complicated by japanese prostitutes particularly at onsen who wish to co opt the prestige of the geisha image by marketing themselves to tourists both japanese and non japanese as geisha and by depictions of geisha in western popular culture
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: traditionally geisha must remain unmarried or retire upon their marriage though it is not uncommon for them to have children
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: while geisha engagements often include flirting and even suggestive banter albeit codified in traditional ways they never involve sexual activity and a geisha is not paid for sex though an individual geisha may choose to engage in sexual relations with one of her patrons outside the context of her role as a geisha
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: and because such relations are related to the ability of a customer to pay for a geisha's traditional services the argument can be made that this is just a convoluted form of prostitution
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: it was also traditional for established geisha to take a danna or patron
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: a danna was typically a wealthy man sometimes married who had the means to support the very large expenses related to a geisha's traditional training and other considerable costs
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: this sometimes occurs today as well
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: although a geisha and her danna may be in love the affair is customarily contingent upon the danna's ability to offer her financial support
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the traditional conventions and values within such a relationship are very intricate and not well understood even by many japanese
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: compared to the modern day street walker japanese geishas are not normally perceived as prostitutes
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: however in most asian cultures those who sell themselves were and are considered prostitutes still despite the lack of sexual encounter professionally
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: selling oneself was considered a disgrace to one's family even if talent not sex was sold
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: due to modern misconceptions and the common flaunting and glorification of prostitution especially those in the media and pop culture subcultures such as ghetto the thoughts of exotic prostitution were justified as a way of life in the conscious mind and hence deteriorated the fundamental ties of geishas to the original meaning of prostitution
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: a geisha's appearance changes throughout her career from the girlish heavily made up maiko to the more sombre appearance of an older established geisha
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: today the traditional make up of the apprentice geisha is one of their most recognizable characteristics though established geisha generally wear full white face makeup characteristic of maiko only during special performances
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the traditional makeup of an apprentice geisha features a thick white base originally made with lead with red lipstick and red and black accents around the eyes and eyebrows
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the application of makeup is hard to perfect and is a time consuming process
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: makeup is applied before dressing to avoid dirtying the kimono
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: first a wax or oil substance called bintsuke abura is applied to the skin
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: next white powder is mixed with water into a paste and applied with a bamboo brush
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the white makeup covers the face neck and chest with two or three unwhitened areas forming a w or v shape left on the nape to accentuate this traditionally erotic area and a line of bare skin around the hairline which creates the illusion of a mask
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: .after the foundation layer is applied a sponge is patted all over the face throat chest and the nape and neck to remove excess moisture and to blend the foundation
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: next the eyes and eyebrows are drawn in
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: traditionally charcoal was used but today modern cosmetics are used
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the eyebrows and edges of the eyes are coloured black a maiko also applies red around her eyes
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the lips are filled in using a small brush
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the colour comes in a small stick which is melted in water
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: crystallized sugar is then added to give the lips lustre
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: for the first three years a maiko wears this heavy makeup almost constantly
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: during her initiation the maiko is helped with her makeup by either her older sister an experienced geisha who is her mentor or the mother of her geisha house
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: after this she applies the makeup herself
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: after a geisha has been working for three years she changes her make up to a more subdued style
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the reason for this is that she has now become mature and the simpler style shows her own natural beauty
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: for formal occasions the mature geisha will still apply white make up
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: for geisha over thirty the heavy white make up is only worn during special dances which require her to wear make up for her part
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: geisha always wear kimono
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: apprentice geisha wear highly colourful kimono with extravagant obi
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: older geisha wear more subdued patterns and styles
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: a geisha is never to be seen in the same kimono more than once whilst entertaining
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the colour pattern and style of kimono is also dependent on the season and the event the geisha is attending
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: in winter geisha can be seen wearing a three quarter length overcoat lined with hand painted silk over their kimono
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: lined kimono are worn during colder seasons and unlined kimono during the summer
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: a kimono can take from 2-3 years to complete due to painting and embroidering
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: geisha wear a flat soled sandal zori outdoors and wear only tabi white split toed socks indoors
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: in inclement weather geisha wear raised wooden clogs called geta
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: maiko wear a special black lacquered wooden clog okobo
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the hairstyles of geisha have varied through history
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: in the past it has been common for women to wear their hair down in some periods but up in others
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: during the 17th century women began putting all their hair up again and it is during this time that the traditional shimada hairstyle a type of traditional chignon worn by most established geisha developed
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: there are four major types of the shimada the taka shimada a high chignon usually worn by young single women the tsubushi shimada a more flattened chignon generally worn by older women the uiwata a chignon that is usually bound up with a piece of colored cotton crepe and a style that resembles a divided peach which is worn only by maiko
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: these hairstyles are decorated with elaborate haircombs and hairpins kanzashi
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: in the seventeenth century and after the meiji restoration period hair combs were large and conspicuous generally more ornate for higher class women
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: following the meiji restoration and into the modern era smaller and less conspicuous hair combs became more popular
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: geisha were trained to sleep with their necks on small supports takamakura instead of pillows so they could keep their hairstyle perfect
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: to reinforce this habit their mentors would pour rice around the base of the support
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: if the geisha's head rolled off the support while they slept rice would stick to their hair and face
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: many modern geisha use wigs in their professional lives
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: they must be regularly tended by highly skilled artisans
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: traditional hairstyling is a dying art
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the growing interest in geisha and their exotic appearance have spawned various popular culture phenomena both in japan and in the west most recently so called geisha inspired make up lines promoted in the west after the popularity of the novel and film memoirs of a geisha
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: in 1999 american singer madonna appeared in her music video for nothing really matters as well as the 1998 grammy awards and her drowned world tour in 2001 dressed in geisha inspired garb with a robe resembling kimono and heavy white make up
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the video game character setsuka from soul calibur iii is likened by fans of the game as an almagation of a geisha and a queen of hearts
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: sanajan kitu saeutik bukti nu kapanggih di shanghai heubeul kacida tur tipe tina periodeu tilu karajaan dina sajarah cina sabab shanghai kiwari kaasup pusat sajarah karajaan wu 222-280

lines.value: wujiaochang 五角场 kiwari di yangpu district sarta daerah sabudeureunna geus diwangun keur pusat kota
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: taun saterusna dina era qianlong shiliupu 十六铺 kiwari di huangpu district jadi palabuan panggedena di asia wetan
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: shanghai tumuwuh gancang kacida dina abad ka 19 kota nu posisina strategis di yangtze river jadi lokasi nu ideal keur dagang jeung nagara nagara eropa
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: during the first opium war in the early 19th century british forces temporarily held shanghai
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the war ended with the 1842 treaty of nanjing which saw the treaty ports shanghai included opened for international trade
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the treaty of the bogue signed in 1843 and the sino american treaty of wangsia signed in 1844 together saw foreign nations achieve extraterritoriality on chinese soil which officially lasted until 1943 but was essentially defunct by the late 1930s
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the taiping rebellion broke out in 1850 and in 1853 shanghai was occupied by a triad offshoot of the rebels called the small swords society
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the fighting destroyed the countryside but left the foreigners settlements untouched and chinese arrived seeking refuge
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: although previously chinese were forbidden to live in foreign settlements 1854 saw new regulations drawn up making land available to chinese
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: land prices rose substantially
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: 1854 also saw the first annual meeting of the shanghai municipal council created in order to manage the foreign settlements
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: in 1863 the british settlement located along the western bank of the huangpu river to the south of suzhou creek huangpu district and american settlement located on the western bank of the huangpu river and to the north of suzhou creek hankou district joined in order to form the international settlement
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the french opted out of the shanghai municipal council and instead maintained its own french concession located to the west of the international settlement
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: this period saw a large influx of migrants from europe and north america who called themselves shanghighlanders
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the sino japanese war fought 1894-95 over control of korea concluded with the treaty of shimonoseki which saw japan emerge as an additional foreign power in shanghai
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: japan built the first factories in shanghai which were soon copied by other foreign powers to effect the emergence of shanghai industry
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: shanghai was then the biggest financial city in the far east
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: under the republic of china shanghai was made a special city in 1927 and a municipality in may 1930
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the japanese navy bombed shanghai on january 28 1932 nominally in an effort to crush down chinese student protests of the manchurian incident and the subsequent japanese occupation
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the chinese fought back in what was known as the january 28 incident
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the two sides fought to a standstill and a ceasefire was brokered in may
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: in the second sino japanese war the city fell after the battle of shanghai in 1937 and was occupied until japan's surrender in 1945
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: during world war ii shanghai was a centre for refugees from europe
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: it was the only city in the world that was open unconditionally to the jews at the time
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: however under pressure from their nazi allies the japanese ghettoised the jewish refugees in late 1941 in what came to be known as the shanghai ghetto and hunger and infectious diseases such as amoebic dysentery became rife
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: on may 27 1949 shanghai came under communist control and was one of the only two former republic of china roc municipalities not merged into neighbouring provinces over the next decade the other being beijing
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: it underwent a series of changes in the boundaries of its subdivisions especially in the next decade
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: after the communist takeover in 1949 most foreign firms moved their offices from shanghai to hong kong
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: during the 1950s and 1960s shanghai became an industrial center and center for revolutionary leftism
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: yet even during the most tumultuous times of the cultural revolution shanghai was able to maintain high economic productivity and relative social stability
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: in most of the history of the people's republic of china prc shanghai has been the largest contributor of tax revenue to the central government compared with other chinese provinces and municipalities
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: this came at the cost of severely crippling shanghai's infrastructure and capital development
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: its importance to china's fiscal well being also denied it economic liberalizations that were started in the far southern provinces such as guangdong during the mid 1980s
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: at that time guangdong province paid nearly no taxes to the central government and thus was perceived as fiscally expendable for experimental economic reforms
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: shanghai was not permitted to initiate economic reforms until 1991
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: political power in shanghai has traditionally been seen as a stepping stone to higher positions within the prc central government.in the 1990s there was what was often described as the politically right of center shanghai clique which included the president of the prc jiang zemin and the premier of the prc zhu rongji
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: starting in 1992 the central government under jiang zemin a former mayor of shanghai began reducing the tax burden on shanghai and encouraging both foreign and domestic investment in order to promote it as the economic hub of east asia and to encourage its role as gateway of investment to the chinese interior
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: since then it has experienced continuous economic growth of between 9 15% annually arguably at the expense of growth in hong kong leading china's overall development
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: shanghai has been a political hub of china for many years
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: many of china's top government officials in beijing are known to have risen in shanghai in the 1980s on a platform that was critical of the extreme leftism of the cultural revolution giving them the tag shanghai clique during the 1990s
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: many observers of chinese politics view the more right leaning shanghai clique as an opposing and competing faction of the current chinese administration under hu jintao
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: shanghai's top jobs the party chief and the position of mayor has always been prominent on a national scale
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: four shanghai mayors eventually went on to take prominent central government positions including former president jiang zemin and former premier zhu rongji
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the top administrative jobs are always appointed directly by the central government
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the current shanghai government under mayor han zheng has openly advocated transparency in the city's government
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: however in previous years a complicated system of relationships between shanghai's government banks and other civil institutions have been under scrutiny for corruption motivated by politics in beijing these allegations from beijing have mostly gone nowhere
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: shanghai is administratively equal to a province and is divided into 19 county level divisions 18 districts and 1 county
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: there is no single downtown district in shanghai the urban core is scattered across several districts
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: prominent central business areas include lujiazui on the east bank of the huangpu river and the bund and hongqiao areas in the west bank of the huangpu river
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the city hall and major administration units are located in huangpu district which also serve as a commercial area including the famous nanjing road
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: other major commercial areas include the classy xintiandi and huaihai road in luwan district and xujiahui in xuhui district
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: many universities in shanghai are located in residential areas of yangpu district and putuo district
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: nine of the districts govern puxi literally west bank or the older part of urban shanghai on the west bank of the huangpu river
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: these nine districts are collectively referred to as shanghai proper 上海市区 or the core city 市中心 pudong east bank or the newer part of urban and suburban shanghai on the east bank of the huangpu river is governed by * pudong new district 浦东新区 pudong xin qu - chuansha county until 1992 eight of the districts govern suburbs satellite towns and rural areas further away from the urban core *chongming county 崇明县 chongming xian as of 2003 these county level divisions are further divided into the following 220 township level divisions 114 towns 3 townships 103 subdistricts
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: those are in turn divided into the following village level divisions 3393 neighborhood committees and 2037 village committees
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: list of towns
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: shanghai is often regarded as the center of finance and trade in mainland china
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: modern development began with economic reforms in 1992 a decade later than many of the southern chinese provinces
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: prior to then much of the city's tax revenue went directly to the capital beijing with little return
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: even with a decreased tax burden after 1992 shanghai's tax contribution to the central government is around 20-25% of the national total shanghai's annual tax burden pre 1990s was on average 70% of the national total
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: shanghai today is the biggest and most developed city in mainland china
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: shanghai is one of the world's busiest ports
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: in 2005 shanghai ranked first of the world's busiest ports in terms of cargo throughput handling a total of 443 million tons of cargo
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: in terms of container traffic it is the third busiest port in the world following singapore and hong kong
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the 2000 census put the population of shanghai municipality to 16.738 million including the floating population which made up 3.871 million
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: since the 1990 census the total population has increased by 3.396 million or 25.5%
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: males accounted for 51.4% females for 48.6% of the population
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: 12.2% were in the age group of 0-14 76.3% between 15 and 64 and 11.5% were older than 65
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: 5.4% of the inhabitants were illiterate
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: as of 2003 the official registered population is 13.42 million however more than 5 million more people work and live in shanghai undocumented and of the 5 million some 4 million belong to the floating population of temporary migrant workers a large proportion of whom are from anhui province as well as jiangsu and zhejiang provinces
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the average life expectancy in 2003 was 79.80 years 77.78 for men and 81.81 for women
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: shanghai and hong kong have had a recent rivalry over which city is to be the economic center of china
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the city had a gdp of ¥46586 ca us$ 5620 per capita in 2003 ranked no
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: 13 among all 659 chinese cities
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: hong kong has the advantage of a stronger legal system and greater banking and service expertise
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: shanghai has stronger links to both the chinese interior and the central government in addition to a stronger base in manufacturing and technology
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: since the handover of hong kong to the prc in 1997 shanghai has increased its role in finance banking and as a major destination for corporate headquarters fueling demand for a highly educated and modernized workforce
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: shanghai has recorded a double digit growth for 14 consecutive years since 1992
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: in 2005 shanghai's nominal gdp posted an 11.1% growth to 912.5 billion yuan us$114 billion
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: as in many other areas in china shanghai is undergoing a building boom
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: in shanghai the modern architecture is notable for its unique style especially in the highest floors with several top floor restaurants which resemble flying saucers
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: for a gallery of these unique architecure designs see shanghai architecture images
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the bulk of shanghai buildings being constructed today are high rise apartments of various height color and design
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: there is now a strong focus by city planners to develop more green areas public parks among the apartment complexes in order to increase the quality of life for shanghai's residents quite in accordance to the better city better life theme of shanghai's expo 2010
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: historically very western in lifestyle shanghai is increasingly a critical center of communication with the western world
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: examples include the opening of the pac med medical exchange in june of 2004 a clearinghouse of medical data and a link between the chinese and westernized medical infrastructures
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: in medicine and other humanitarian fields china is actively seeking input of first world nations to improve living conditions and trade status
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: arguments for and against modern chinese leadership question the genuine influence the influx of western culture and technology will have on vast chinese interior outside of the densely populated often visited urban centres
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the pudong district of shanghai contains contemporary architecture and modern feeling districts in close proximity to major international trade and hospitality zones
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: visitors to shanghai find free public parks manicured to startling perfection in distinct contrast to the massive industrial installations which reveal china's emerging environmental concerns
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: shanghai's international diversity is perhaps the world's foremost window into the rich historic and complex society of today's china
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: shanghai faces the east china sea part of the pacific ocean and is bisected by the huangpu river
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: puxi contains the city proper on the western side of huangpu river while an entirely new financial district has been erected on the eastern bank of the huangpu in pudong
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: :geographical coordinates shanghai experiences all four seasons with freezing temperatures during the winter season and a 32 degrees celsius 90 degrees fahrenheit average high during the hottest months of july and august
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: temperatures extremes of -10c 14f and +41c 105f have been recorded
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: heavy rain is frequent in early summer
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: spring starts in march summer in june autumn in september and winter in december
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the weather in spring although considered the most beautiful season is highly variable with frequent rain and alternating spells of warmth and cold
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: summer is the peak tourist season but is hot and oppressive as the humidity makes it almost impossible for people not used to the environment to breathe properly
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: clothes tend to get fairly wet after minutes of walking
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: autumn is generally sunny and dry and the foliage season is in november
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: winters are typically grey and dreary with no snowfall
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the city has a few typhoon spells during the year none of which in recent years have caused considerable damage
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the previous total solar eclipse to be seen from the center of shanghai () occurred on may 10 1575
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the next total solar eclipse that will be seen from shanghai will be solar eclipse of 2009-jul-22
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: wikisource has an article about solar eclipses as seen from shanghai from 2001 to 3000
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: shanghai has an extensive public transportation system largely based on buses and a rapidly expanding metro system
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: for a city of shanghai's size road traffic is fairly smooth and convenient
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: shanghai has the world's most extensive bus system with nearly one thousand bus lines
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the shanghai metro subway and elevated lightrail has five lines numbers 1 2 3 4 5 at present
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: according to the development schedule of the municipal government by the year 2010 another 8 lines will be built in shanghai
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: bus and metro fares run from ¥1 to ¥4 depending on distance or between 12 to 50 us cents
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: taxis in shanghai are plentiful and market competition has driven taxi fare down to affordable prices for the average resident ¥10 or a little over one us dollar for 3 km
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: before the 1990s bicycling was the most ubiquitous form of transportion in shanghai but the city has since banned bicycles on many of the city's main roads to ease congestion
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: with rising disposable incomes private car ownership in shanghai has also been rapidly increasing in recent years
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: shanghai has two airports hongqiao and pudong international which has the second highest combined traffic in china following hong kong international airport
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: in cooperation with the shanghai municipality and the shanghai maglev transportation development co smt german transrapid constructed the first commercial maglev railway in the world in 2002 from shanghai's longyang road subway station to pudong international airport
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: commercial operation started in 2003
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the 30km trip takes 7 minutes and 21 seconds and reaches a maximum speed of 431 km h
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: as of december 2005 shanghai's port including the newly opened yangshan deep water port 洋山深水港 is the largest in the world
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: what is currently longest cross sea bridge of the world the donghai bridge 东海大桥 with a total length 32.5km links shanghai on the mainland to the yangshan islands
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: three railways intersect in shanghai jinghu railway beijing-shanghai railway passing through nanjing 京沪线 shanghai hangzhou railway 沪杭线 hu hang line and xiaoshan ningbo 萧甬线 xiao yong line
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: shanghai has three passenger railway stations shanghai railway station shanghai west railway station and shanghai south railway station
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: a maglev train route to hangzhou shanghai-hangzhou maglev train 沪杭磁悬浮线 will begin construction in 2006 and is planned to be finished in 2008
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: a high speed train to beijing is also in the works
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: expressways from beijing jinghu expressway and from the region around shanghai connect to the city
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: there are ambitious plans to build expressways connecting shanghai's chongming island with the urban core
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: within shanghai itself there are elevated roads which appear expressway like in road conditions direction-separated lanes
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: tunnels and bridges are used to link puxi to pudong
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the vernacular language is shanghainese a dialect of wu chinese while the official language is standard mandarin
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the local dialect is mutually unintelligible with mandarin and is an inseparable part of the shanghainese identity
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the shanghainese dialect today is a mixture of standard wu chinese as spoken in suzhou with the dialects of ningbo and other nearby regions whose peoples have migrated to shanghai in large numbers since the 20th century
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: nearly all shanghainese under the age of 50 can speak mandarin fluently
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: fluency in foreign languages is unevenly distributed
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: most senior residents who received a university education before the revolution and those who worked in foreign enterprises can speak fluent english
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: those under the age of 26 have had contact with english since primary school as english is taught as a mandatory course starting at grade 3
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: songjiang school 淞江派 is a small painting school during the ming dynasty
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: it is commomnly considered as a further development of the wu school or wumen school 吴门画派 in the then cultural center of the region suzhou
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: huating school 华亭派 was another important art school during the middle to late ming dynasty
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: its main achievements were in traditional chinese painting calligraphy and poetry and especially famous for its renwen painting 人文画
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: dong qichang 董其昌 is one of the masters from this school
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the shanghai school 海上画派 haishang huapai or 海派 haipai is a very important chinese school of traditional arts during the qing dynasty and the whole of 20th century
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: under efforts of masters from this school traditional chinese art reached another climax and continued to the present in forms of the chinese painting 中国画 or guohua 国画 for short
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the shanghai school challenged and broke the literati tradition of chinese art while also paying technical homage to the ancient masters and improving on existing traditional techniques
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: members of this school were themselves educated literati who had come to question their very status and the purpose of art and had anticipated the impending modernization of chinese society
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: in an era of rapid social change works from the shanghai school were widely innovative and diverse and often contained thoughtful yet subtle social commentary
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the most well known figures from this school are ren xiong 任熊 ren yi 任伯年 zhao zhiqian 赵之谦 wu changshuo 吴昌硕 sha menghai 沙孟海 calligraphist pan tianshou 潘天寿 fu baoshi 傅抱石
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: because of shanghai's status as the cultural and economic center of east asia for the first half of the twentieth century it is popularly seen as the birthplace of everything considered modern in china
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: it was in shanghai for example that the first motor car was driven and the first train tracks and modern sewers were laid
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: it was also the intellectual battleground between socialist writers who concentrated on critical realism pioneered by lu xun and mao dun and the more bourgeois more romantically and aesthetically inclined writers such as shi zhecun shao xunmei ye lingfeng eileen chang
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: besides literature shanghai was also the birthplace of chinese cinema & theater
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: china's first short film the difficult couple nanfu nanqi 1913 and the country's first fictional feature film orphan rescues grandfather gu'er jiu zuji 1923 were both produced in shanghai
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: these two films were very influential and established shanghai as the center of chinese film making
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: shanghai's film industry went on to blossom during the early thirties generating marilyn monroe like stars such as zhou xuan
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: another film star jiang qing went on to become madame mao zedong
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the talent and passion of shanghainese filmmakers following world war ii and the communist revolution contributed enormously to the development of the hong kong film industry
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: much of shanghainese popular culture shanghainese pops were transferred to hong kong by the numerous shanghainese emigrants and refugees after the communist revolution
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the movie in the mood for love huayang nianhua directed by wong kar wai a native shanghainese himself depicts one slice of the displaced shanghainese community in hong kong and the nostalgia for that era featuring 1940s music by zhou xuan
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: shanghainese people have often been stereotyped by other chinese both urban and rural as being materialistic pretentious and disdainful of provincials and at the same time however they are admired for their meticulous attention to detail faithfulness in contract professionalism and style
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: it is a belief of many chinese from other provinces of china that shanghainese men can be very henpecked nagged or controlled by their wives
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: admittedly there is some truth in the opinion husbands in shanghai often simultaneously play the roles of a bread winner father cook plumber carpenter etc interestingly this view though somewhat outmoded in the context of the new century is still one of the first things many people think of at the mention of shanghai
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: only very few residents are descended from original inhabitants of the old walled city
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: nearly all registered shanghainese residents are descendants of immigrants from the two adjacent provinces of jiangsu and zhejiang who moved to shanghai in the late 19th and the early 20th century
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: these are regions that generally speak the same family of dialects as shanghainese wu chinese
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: much of pre modern shanghainese culture is an integration of cultural elements from these two regions
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the shanghainese dialect reflects this as well
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: despite this heterogeneous origin to the shanghainese population there has been a strong sense of shanghainese identity founded upon cultural and economical superiority up until the revolution
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the revolution was a humbling experience for shanghai as a whole as it was brought into line by the communist regime whose ideology favoured grass root agriculture and industry and opposed bourgeois excesses which shanghai stood for in the eyes of many
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: this led to a spiraling cycle with the shanghainese eyeing the rest of the country with disdain as provincials 乡下人 xianwonin in shanghainese while the rest of the country thought of the shanghainese as arrogant and petty
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: this has been fuelled in recent times by migrants from all over china who do not speak the local dialect and are therefore forced to use mandarin as a lingua franca
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: rising crime rates littering harassive panhandling and an overloading of the basic infrastructure mainly public transportation schools associated with the rise of these migrant populations over 3 million new migrants in 2003 alone have been generating some ill will from the shanghainese
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the new migrants are easy to spot by the shanghainese and are often targets of both intentional and unintentional discrimination
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: this further intensifies the misunderstandings and stereotypes between the shanghainese and the chinese outside of the lower yangtze basin
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: one uniquely shanghainese cultural element is the shikumen 石库门 residences which are two or three story townhouses with the front yard protected by a high brick wall
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: each residence is connected and arranged in straight alleys known as a longtang 弄堂 pronounced longdang in shanghainese
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the entrance to each alley is usually surmounted by a stylistic stone arch
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the whole resembles terrace houses or townhouses commonly seen in anglo american countries but distinguished by the tall heavy brick wall in front of each house
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the name shikumen literally means stone storage door referring to the strong gateway to each house
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the shikumen is a cultural blend of elements found in western architecture with traditional lower yangtze jiangnan chinese architecture and social behavior
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: all traditional chinese dwellings had a courtyard and the shikumen was no exception
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: yet to compromise with its urban nature it was much smaller and provided an interior haven to the commotions in the streets allowing for raindrops to fall and vegetation to grow freely within a residence
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the courtyard also allowed sunlight and adequate ventilation into the rooms
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: this style of housing originally developed when local developers adapted terrace houses to chinese conditions
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the wall was added to protect against fighting and looting during the taiping rebellion and later burglars and vandals during the social upheavals of the early twentieth century
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: by world war ii more than 80% of the population in the city lived in these kinds of dwellings
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: many of these were hastily built and were akin to slums while others were of sturdier construction and featured all modern amenities such as the flushing toilet
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: during and after world war ii massive population increases in shanghai led many shikumen houses to be heavily subdivided
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: for example the spacious living room is often divided into three or four rooms each lent out to a family
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: these cramped conditions continue to exist in many of the shikumen districts that have survived recent development
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the landlords who leased subletted the shikumen out to other families were called erfangdong or second landlord as many of them acquired the shikumen buildings from its original owner dafangdong
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: these landlords families usually share the same shikumen building with the tenants
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: other shanghainese cultural artifacts include the cheongsam shanghainese zansae a modernization of the traditional chinese/manchurian qipao (; shanghainese gibo garment which first appeared in the 1910s in shanghai
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the cheongsam dress was slender with high cut sides and tight fitting
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: this contrasts sharply with the traditional qipao which was designed to conceal the figure and be worn regardless of age
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the cheongsam went along well with the western overcoat and the scarf and portrayed an unique east asian modernity epitomizing the shanghainese population in general
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: as western fashions changed the basic cheongsam design changed too introducing high necked sleeveless dresses bell like sleeves and the black lace frothing at the hem of a ball gown
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: by the 1940s cheongsams came in transparent black beaded bodices matching capes and even velvet
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: and later checked fabrics became also quite common
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the 1949 communist revolution ended the cheongsam and other fashions in shanghai
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: however the shanghainese styles have seen a recent revival as stylish party dresses
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the fashion industry has been rapidly revitalizing in the past decade there is on average one fashion show per day in shanghai today
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: like shanghai's architecture local fashion designers strive to create a fusion of western and traditional designs often with innovative if not controversial results
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: shanghai is home to many of china's top and oldest universities
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: *shanda university 上海杉达学院 note institutions without full time bachelor programs are not listed
lines.name: Sundanese
