lines.value: there is great variation in the lengths of the days between the planets
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: mars's day is only 37 minutes longer that earth's venus's is far longer at 243 days
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the gas giants all have rotational periods lasting only a few hours
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: planets also have varying degrees of axial tilt they lie at an angle to the ecliptic plane
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: this causes the amount of sunlight received by each hemisphere to vary over the course of its year when the northern hemisphere points away from the sun the southern hemisphere points towards it and vice versa
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: each planet therefore possesses seasons changes to the climate over the course of its year
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: jupiter's axial tilt is very small so its seasonal variation is minimal uranus on the other hand has an axial tilt so extreme it is virtually on its side which means that its hemispheres are either perpetually in sunlight or perpetually in darkness around the time of its solstices
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: *measured relative to the earth
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: **see earth article for absolute values
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: before the august 2006 debate many objects were proposed by astronomers including at one stage by the iau as planets
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: however in 2006 several of these objects were reclassified as dwarf planets
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: dwarf planets are not planets according to the iau
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: currently three dwarf planets in the solar system are recognized by iau those are ceres pluto and eris
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: dwarf planets share many of the same characteristics as planets although notable differences remain
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: their attributes are *measured relative to the earth
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: by definition all dwarf planets are members of larger populations
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: ceres is the largest body in the asteroid belt while pluto is a member of the kuiper belt and eris is a member of the scattered disc
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: according to mike brown there may soon be over forty trans neptunian objects that qualify as dwarf planets under the iau's recent definition
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: astronomers distinguish between planets dwarf planets and small solar system bodies
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the large bodies within earth's solar system can be divided into categories according to composition
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: of the 207 extrasolar planets those outside our solar system discovered to date september 2006 most have masses which are about the same as or larger than jupiter's
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: exceptions include a number of planets discovered orbiting burned out star remnants called pulsars such as psr b1257+12 the planets orbiting the stars mu arae 55 cancri and gj 436 which are approximately neptune sized and a planet orbiting gliese 876 that is estimated to be about 6 to 8 times as massive as the earth and is probably rocky in composition
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: it is far from clear if the newly discovered large planets would resemble the gas giants in our solar system or if they are of an entirely different type as yet unknown like ammonia giants or carbon planets
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: in particular some of the newly discovered planets known as hot jupiters orbit extremely close to their parent stars in nearly circular orbits
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: they therefore receive much more stellar radiation than the gas giants in our solar system which makes it questionable whether they are the same type of planet at all
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: there is also a class of hot jupiters that orbit so close to their star that their atmospheres are slowly blown away in a comet like tail the chthonian planets
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: several projects have been proposed to create an array of space telescopes to search for extrasolar planets with masses comparable to the earth
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the nasa terrestrial planet finder was one such program but as of 2006-02-06 this program has been put on indefinite hold
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the esa is considering a comparable mission called darwin
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the frequency of occurrence of such terrestrial planets is one of the variables in the drake equation which estimates the number of intelligent communicating civilizations that exist in our galaxy
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: in 2005 astronomers detected a planet in a triple star system a finding that challenges current theories of planetary formation
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the planet a gas giant slightly larger than jupiter orbits the main star of the hd 188753 system in the constellation cygnus and is hence known as hd 188753 ab
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the stellar trio yellow orange and red is about 149 light years from earth
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the planet which is at least 14% larger than jupiter orbits the main star hd 188753 a once every 80 hours or so 3.3 days at a distance of about 8 gm a twentieth of the distance between earth and the sun
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the other two stars whirl tightly around each other in 156 days and circle the main star every 25.7 years at a distance from the main star that would put them between saturn and uranus in our own solar system
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the latter stars invalidate the leading hot jupiter formation theory which holds that these planets form at normal distances and then migrate inward through some debatable mechanism
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: this could not have occurred here the outer star pair would have disrupted outer planet formation
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: interstellar planets are rogues in interstellar space not gravitationally linked to any given solar system
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: for a brief time in 2006 astronomers believed they had found a binary system of interstellar planets which they termed oph 162225-240515
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: however recent analysis of the objects has determined that their masses are each greater than 13 jupiter masses making the pair once considered to be planemos brown dwarfs
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the existence of actual interstellar planets is considered likely based on computer simulations of the origin and evolution of planetary systems which often include the ejection of bodies of significant mass.the term is a controversial one
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: a prominent school of astronomers including the iau argue that only objects that orbit stars qualify as planets and thus an interstellar planet is an oxymoron
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the discoverers of the bodies mentioned above decided to avoid the debate over what constitutes a planet by referring to the objects as planemos
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: see also definition of planet
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: bayes theorem says that the posterior probability measure is proportional to the product of the prior probability measure and the likelihood function

lines.value: proportional to implies that one must multiply or divide by a normalizing constant in order to assign measure 1 to the whole space i.e to get a probability measure

lines.value: dina statistik covariance matrix nyaruakeun konsep varian tina hiji ka n dimension dina basa sejen bentuk nilai scalar random variable ka nilai vector random variables tuple tina variabel random skalar

lines.value: lamun x mangrupa nilai skalar variabel random nu mibanda nilai ekspektasi &mu mangka variance na nyaeta the entries in this matrix are the covariances between the n different scalar components of x since the covariance between a scalar valued random variable and itself is its variance it follows that in particular the entries on the diagonal of this matrix are the variances of the scalar components of x this may appear to be a property of this matrix that depends on which coordinate system is chosen for the space in which the random vector x resides

lines.value: it may be more intuitive to define the stronger of two acids as the one which reacts more completely with a common base

lines.value: the following shows that this definition gives the same result

lines.value: compare the reactions of the two acids hx and hy with the same base z in a mixture containing all these species :[x ][hy] [hx][y ] = k x k y given that this last quantity is the equilibrium constant for the above reaction the reaction will tend to the right if k x k y &gt 1 in other words if hx is a stronger acid than hy under this definition and vice versa
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: acids and bases in the bronsted-lowry system occur in conjugate pairs in the reaction :hx → h + + x hx is called the conjugate acid of the base x , and x is called the conjugate base of the acid hx

lines.value: some compounds like water can act either as an acid or a base and are called amphoteric compounds

lines.value: if we consider a solvent which can be dissociated into a positive species x and a negative species y : xy ↔ x + + y or : 2xy ↔ x 2 y + + y or : 2xy ↔ x + + xy 2 a compound causing an increase in x + or x 2 y + ) and a decrease in y or xy 2 ) is an acid and one causing the reverse is a base

lines.value: the more general definition offered by lewis in 1923 the same year as the bronsted-lowry definition describes the reactivity of an acid in terms of its ability to accept a pair of electrons from a base defined as an electron pair donor
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: in general an acid reacts with a base by forming a new covalent bond utilizing an empty orbital of the acid to share the extra electron pair of the base

lines.value: that is an acid base reaction is the combination of homo from base and lumo from acid to form a stable bonding molecular orbital

lines.value: the lewis definition is one of the most broad definitions and is necessary for an understanding of acid base reaction although the bronsted-lowry definition is sufficient and more practical for most cases in everyday use

lines.value: the most general definition is that of the russian chemist usanovich and can basically be summarized as defining an acid as anything that accepts negative species or donates positive ones and a base as the reverse

lines.value: aya dua cara pikeun ngontrol reungit 1 program badag nu dikokolakeun pikeun ngurangan populasi reungit nu ngawengku wilayah anu lega jeung 2 peta individual pikeun ngajaga diri jeung lingkungan dumukna
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: kiwari program ngontrol reungit dumasar kana prinsip prinsip integrasi ngokolakeun hama nu biasana ngawengku sababaraha ukuran dumasar kana pangaweruh urang ngeunaan daur hirup reungit : habitat modification such as ditching or diking marshes or manipulating daily water flows can be effective at reducing mosquito populations by disrupting the mosquito life cycle but experience has shown that such large scale programs can be harmful to the ecosystem if not undertaken carefully
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: one example of a successful approach to habitat modification open marsh water management involves the use of shallow ditches to connect the shallow waters where mosquitoes breed to deeper waters where natural predators live
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: simply giving the predators access to the mosquito larvae can result in long term mosquito control
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: biocontrol is the direct introduction of predators to target mosquitoes
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: effective biocontrol agents include predatory fish that feed on mosquito larvae such as gambusia affinis and other minnows and killifish
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: some other biocontrol agents that have had lesser degrees of success include the predator mosquito toxorhynchites and predator crustaceans nematodes and fungi
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: some public agencies also employ other predators such as birds bats dragonflies and frogs but evidence of effectiveness of these agents is only anecdotal
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: in particular there is no documented study that establishes that bats or purple martins consume enough mosquitoes to significantly control mosquito populations
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: also used as biological control agent are the dead spores of varieties of the natural soil bacteria bacillus thuringiensis especially bt israelensis bti
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: bti is used to interfere in the digestion systems of larvae
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: it can be dispersed by hand or dropped by helicopter in large areas
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: bti is no longer effective after the larvae turn into pupae because they stop eating
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: at this point larviciding oils such as golden bear can be used which increase the water tension until the pupae and larvae cannot break the surface to obtain air and therefore drown
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: a chemical commonly used in the united states is methoprene considered slightly toxic to larger animals which mimics and interferes with natural growth hormones in mosquito larvae preventing development
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: methoprene is frequently distributed in time release briquette form in breeding areas
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: adulticide the ground or aerial application of chemical pesticides is less effective than the other methods of mosquito control and is generally considered a method of last resort
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: nevertheless careful application of adulticide is considered a critical part of integrated mosquito management
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: for example ultra low volume ulv spraying of malathion has been used in metropolitan areas like new york city to decrease the mosquito population and prevent the spread of west nile virus
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the most effective solutions for malaria control efforts in the third world are mosquito nets (), insecticide laced mosquito nets and ddt
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: plain mosquito nets are cheap they are completely effective in protecting humans within the net they do not adversely affect the health of natural predators such as dragonflies and do not require sophisticated public health capacity on the part of the government
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the role of ddt in combating mosquitoes has been the subject of considerable controversy
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: while some argue that ddt deeply damages biodiversity others argue that ddt is the most effective weapon in combating mosquitoes and hence malaria
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: while some of this disagreement is based on differences in the extent to which disease control is valued as opposed to the value of biodiversity there is also genuine disagreement amongst experts about the costs and benefits of using ddt
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: moreover ddt resistant mosquitoes have started to increase in numbers especially in tropics due to mutations reducing the effectiveness of this chemical.-->
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: industrially ozone is produced with short wavelength ultraviolet radiation from a mercury vapor lamp or the application of a high voltage electrical field in a process called cold or corona discharge
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the cold discharge apparatus consists of two metal plates separated by an air gap and a high dielectric strength electrical insulator such as borosilicate glass or mica
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: a high voltage alternating current is applied to the plates and the ozone is formed in the air gap when o 2 molecules disassociate and recombine into o 3
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: a faint corona may be present in the air gap but the voltage is maintained below that which would cause punch through of the insulator with subsequent arcing and plasma formation
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: in the laboratory ozone can be produced by electrolysis using a 9 volt battery a pencil graphite rod cathode a platinum wire anode and a 3m sulfuric acid electrolyte
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the half cell reactions taking place are
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: ozone can be used for bleaching substances and for killing bacteria
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: many municipal drinking water systems kill bacteria with ozone instead of the more common chlorine
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: ozone does not form organochlorine compounds but it also does not remain in the water after treatment so some systems introduce a small amount of chlorine to prevent bacterial growth in the pipes or may use chlorine intermittently based on results of periodic testing
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: where electrical power is abundant ozone is a cost effective method of treating water as it is produced on demand and does not require transportation and storage of hazardous chemicals
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: once it has decayed it leaves no taste or odor in drinking water
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: industrially ozone or ozonated water is used to
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: ozone along with hypochlorite ions is naturally produced by white blood cells and the roots of marigolds as a means of destroying foreign bodies
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: when ozone breaks down it gives rise to oxygen free radicals which are highly reactive and damage or destroy most organic molecules
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: ozone has a number of medical uses
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: it can be used to affect the body's antioxidant prooxidant balance since the body usually reacts to its presence by producing antioxidant enzymes
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: many hospitals in the us and around the world use large ozone generators to decontaminate operating rooms between surgeries
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the rooms are cleaned and then sealed airtight before being filled with ozone which effectively kills or neutralizes all remaining bacteria
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: ozone therapy has blossomed into a thriving field of alternative medicine and there are a host of claimed applications above and beyond what has actually been verified by studies
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: in the united states ozone therapy is illegal as the food and drug administration fda has not approved its use on humans
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: medical ozone therapy is recognized in bulgaria cuba czech republic france germany israel italy mexico romania and russia
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: it is currently used legally in 16 nations
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: at least 12 states in the usa ak az co ga mn ny nc oh ok or sc and wa have passed legislation to ensure that alternative therapies are available to consumers
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: physicians in those states can legally use ozone as an alternative treatment in their practice without fear of prosecution
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: at least one death has been attributed to application of ozone through in the us air cleaners which produce activated oxygen i.e ozone are often sold in the us nonetheless
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: see air ioniser
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: see main articles tropospheric ozone and air pollution
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: ozone is not directly emitted by car engines or by industrial operations themselves
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: these sources emit hydrocarbons and nitrogen oxides that react with sunlight to form ozone directly at the source of the pollution being emitted and in the atmosphere's boundary layer 1 to 3 km altitude
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the mix of hydrocarbons nitrogen oxides and ozone are the major components of smog that frequently occurs in urban and suburban areas
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: recent satellite maps of nitrogen dioxide no 2 ) clearly show the worldwide distribution of polluted regions associated with industrial activity automobiles factories and fossil fuel power generation
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: there is a great deal of evidence to show that ozone at the earth's surface can harm lung function and irritate the respiratory system who europe reports cited below
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: ozone has been found to convert cholesterol in the blood stream to plaque which causes hardening and narrowing of arteries
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: this cholesterol product has also been implicated in alzheimer's disease suggesting a link between the inflammatory response associated with head injury and alzheimer's
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: air quality guidelines such as those from the world health organization are based on detailed studies of what levels can cause measurable health effects
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: although ozone was present at ground level before the industrial revolution peak concentrations are far higher than the pre industrial levels and even background concentrations well away from sources of pollution are substantially higher
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: ozone reacts directly with some hydrocarbons such as aldehydes and thus begins their removal from the air but the products of ozonolysis are themselves key components of smog
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: ozone photolysis by uv light leads to production of the hydroxyl radical and this plays a part in the removal of hydrocarbons from the air but is again a step in the creation of components of smog such as peroxyacyl nitrates which are powerful eye irritants
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: ultimately ozone is one component of smog which is harmful in itself and contributes both to the production and ultimate removal of other air pollutants.-->
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: < if that ratio is &lambda and the null hypothesis holds then for commonly occurring families of probability distributions −2 log &lambda has a particularly handy asymptotic distribution
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: many common test statistics such as the z test the f test and uji kuadrat chi pearson can be phrased as log likelihood ratios or approximations thereof
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: many of these approximations were quite useful when computers did not exist but now that taking a log is really no more vexing than multiplying two numbers other approximations may be more useful especially in special cases where the approximations are suspect
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: a statistical model is often a parametrized family of probability density functions or probability mass functions f &theta x
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: a null hypothesis is often stated by saying the parameter &theta is in a specified subset &theta 0 of the parameter space &theta
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the likelihood function is l(&theta = l(θ| x = p(x|&theta = f &theta x is a function of the parameter &theta with x held fixed at the value that was actually observed i.e the data
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the likelihood ratio is this is a function of the data x and is therefore a statistic
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the likelihood ratio test rejects the null hypothesis if the value of this statistic is too small and is justified by the neyman pearson lemma
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: how small is too small depends on the significance level of the test i.e on what probability of type i error is considered tolerable type i error consist of rejection of a null hypothesis that is true
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: if the null hypothesis is true then −2 log &lambda will be asymptotically &chi 2 distributed with degrees of freedom equal to the difference in dimensionality of &theta and &theta 0 .for instance in the case of pearson's test we might try to compare two coins to determine whether they have the same probability of coming up heads
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: our observation can be put into a contingency table with rows corresponding to the coin and columns corresponding to heads or tails
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the elements of the contingency table will be the number of times the coin for that row came up heads or tails
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the contents of this table are our observation x here &omega consists of the parameters p 1h p 1t , p 2h , and p 2t which are the probability that coin 1 2 comes up heads tails
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the hypothesis space h is defined by the usual constraints on a distribution p ij &ge 0 p ij &le 1 and p ih + p it = 1
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the null hypothesis h 0 is the sub space where p 1j = p 2j
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: in all of these constraints i = 12 and j = h,t
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the hypothesis and null hypothesis can be rewritten slightly so that they satisfy the constraints for the log likelihood ratio to have the desired nice distribution
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: since the constraint causes the two dimensional h to be reduced to the one dimensional h 0 the asymptotic distribution for the test will be &chi 2 1 the &chi 2 distribution with one degree of freedom
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: for the general contingency table we can write the log likelihood ratio statistic as bayesian criticisms of classical likelihood ratio tests focus on two issues
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: as mentioned they lack the complex organization found in most other phyla

lines.value: their cells are differentiated but not organized into distinct tissues
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: sponges are sessile and typically feed by drawing in water through pores all over the body which is supported by a skeleton typically divided into spicules
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the extinct archaeocyatha which have fused skeletons may represent sponges or a separate phylum
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: among the eumetazoan phyla two are radially symmetric and have digestive chambers with a single opening which serves as both the mouth and the anus
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: these are the cnidaria which include anemones corals and jellyfish and the ctenophora or comb jellies
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: both have distinct tissues but they are not organized into organs
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: there are only two main germ layers the ectoderm and endoderm with only scattered cells between them
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: as such these animals are sometimes called diploblastic
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the tiny phylum placozoa is similar but individuals do not have a permanent digestive chamber
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the remaining animals form a monophyletic group called the bilateria
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: for the most part they are bilaterally symmetric and often have a specialized head with feeding and sensory organs
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the body is triploblastic i.e all three germ layers are well developed and tissues form distinct organs
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the digestive chamber has two openings a mouth and an anus and there is also an internal body cavity called a coelom or pseudocoelom
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: there are exceptions to each of these characteristics however for instance adult echinoderms are radially symmetric and certain parasitic worms have extremely simplified body structures
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: genetic studies have considerably changed our understanding of the relationships within the bilateria
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: most appear to belong to four major lineages
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: <!the eagle has been used by many nations as a national symbol depicting power beauty and independence

lines.value: the function of a flower is to mediate the union of male and female gametes
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the process is termed pollination
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: many flowers are dependent upon the wind to move pollen between flowers of the same species
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: others rely on animals especially insects to accomplish this feat
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the period of time during which this process can take place the flower is fully expanded and functional is called anthesis
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: many flowers in nature have evolved to attract animals to pollinate the flower the movements of the pollinating agent contributing to the opportunity for genetic recombinations within a dispersed plant population
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: flowers that are insect pollinated are called entomophilous literally insect loving
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: flowers commonly have nectaries on their various parts that attract these animals
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: bees and birds are common pollinators both have color vision thus selecting for colorful flowers
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: some flowers have patterns called nectar guides that are evident in the ultraviolet range visible to bees but not to humans
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: flowers also attract pollinators by scent
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: in any case pollinators are attracted to the plant perhaps in search of nectar which they eat
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the arrangement of the stamens insures that pollen grains are transferred to the bodies of the pollinator
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: in gathering nectar from many flowers of the same species the pollinators transfer pollen between all of the flowers it visits
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: flower scent is not always pleasant to our sense of smell
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: some plants such as rafflesia the titan arum and the north american pawpaw asimina triloba are pollinated by flies so produce a scent imitating rotting meat
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: other flowers are pollinated by the wind and the flowers of these species for example grasses have no need to attract pollinators and therefore tend not to be showy
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: wind pollinated flowers are referred to as anemophilous
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: whereas the pollen of entomophilous flowers tends to be large grained sticky and contain significant protein another reward for pollinators anemophilous flower pollen is usually small grained very light and of little nutritional value to insects though it may still be gathered in times of dearth
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: honeybees and bumblebees actively gather anemophilous corn maize pollen though it is of little value to them
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: there is much confusion about the role of flowers in allergies
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: for example the showy and entomophilous goldenrod solidago is frequently blamed for respiratory allergies of which it is innocent since its pollen cannot be airborne
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: instead the allergen is usually the pollen of the contemporary bloom of anemophilous ragweed ambrosia which can drift for many kilometers
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the great variety of delicate and beautiful flowers has inspired the works of many poets
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: ah sun flower weary of time who countest the steps of the sun seeking after that sweet golden clime where the traveller's journey is done where the youth pined away with desire and the pale virgin shrouded in snow arise from their graves and aspire where my sun flower wishes to go
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: :- william blake ah
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: sun flower the roman goddess of flowers gardens and the season of spring is flora
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the greek goddess of spring flowers and nature is chloris
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.name: Sundanese

lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: tulang dina tonggong atawa kolom vertebral disebut vertebrae
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: vertebrata mangrupa subfilum chordata pangbadagna nu ngawengku sasatoan nu ilahar dipikawanoh ku manusa iwal insekta
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: lauk kaasup belut ampibi reptil manuk jeung mamalia kaasup manusa teh kaasup vertebrata
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: ciri lianna subfilum ieu nyaeta ayana sistim otot jeung sistim saraf pusat nu sawareh aya dina jero tulang tonggong
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: ciri nu ngawatesan vertebrata nyaeta tulang tonggong atawa sungsum tulang uteuk nu kawadahan dina tangkorak sarta rorongkong internal
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the internal skeleton which defines vertebrates consists of cartilage or bone or in some cases both
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: an outer skeleton in form of a bony armour was the first bony substance the vertebrates evolved
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: it is possible its primary function was as a phosphate reservoir excreted as calcium phosphate and stored around the body offering protection at the same time
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the skeleton provides support to the organism during the period of growth
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: for this reason vertebrates can achieve larger sizes than invertebrates and on average vertebrates are in fact larger
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the skeleton of most vertebrates that is excluding the most primitive ones consists of a skull the vertebral column and two pairs of limbs
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: in some forms of vertebrates one or both of these pairs of limbs may be absent such as in snakes or whales
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: these limbs have been lost in the course of evolution
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the skull is thought to have facilitated the development of intelligence as it protects vital organs such as the brain the eyes and the ears
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the protection of these organs is also thought to have positively influenced the development of high responsiveness to the environment often found in vertebrates
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: both the vertebral column and the limbs support the body of the vertebrate overall
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: this support facilitates movement
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: movement is normally achieved with muscles that are attached directly to the bones or cartilages
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the contour of the body of a vertebrate is formed by the muscles
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: a skin covers the inner parts of a vertebrate's body
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the skin sometimes acts as a structure for protective features such as horny scales or fur
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: feathers are also attached to the skin
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the trunk of a vertebrate is hollow and houses the internal organs
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the heart and the respiratory organs are protected in the trunk
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the heart is located behind the gills or where there are lungs in between the lungs
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the central nervous system of a vertebrate consists of the brain and the spinal cord
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: both of these are characterized by being hollow
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: in lower vertebrates the brain mostly controls the functioning of the sense organs
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: in higher vertebrates the size of the brain relative to the size of the body is larger
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: this larger brain enables more intensive exchange of information between the different parts of the brain
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the nerves from the spinal cord which lies behind the brain extend to the skin the inner organs and the muscles
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: some nerves are directly connected to the brain linking the brain with the ears and lungs
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: vertebrates have been traced back to the ostracoderms of the silurian period 444 million to 409 million years ago and the conodonts a group of eel like vertebrates characterized by multiple pairs of bony toothplates
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: all vertebrates have the ability to form bones paired specialised sensory organs and a brain
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: rorongkong ieu mangrupa pangrojong organismena nalika tumuwuh
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: ku kituna vertebrata bisa boga awak leuwih badag batan invertebrata
